To Amend Sections 73-7-9, 73-7-12, 73-7-19, 73-7-35 And 73-7-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 73-7-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On Those Sections; And For Related Purposes.

1164.title: Mississippi Auctioneers License Act; extend repealer.
1164.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 73-4-1 Through 73-4-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Auctioneers License Act; To Amend Reenacted Sections 73-4-23, 73-4-27 And 73-4-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Technical Corrections; To Amend Section 73-4-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On The Mississippi Auctioneers License Act; And For Related Purposes.

1165.title: MS Organic Certification Program; reenact and extend repealer on provisions of.
1165.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 69-47-1, 69-47-5, 69-47-7, 69-47-9, 69-47-13, 69-47-17, 69-47-19, 69-47-21, 69-47-23 And 69-47-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establish The Mississippi Organic Certification Program And Prescribe The Various Provisions For Its Administration And Operation; To Bring Forward Section 69-47-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Recertification Of A Farm, Field Or Greenhouse After Removal From Organic Management; To Bring Forward Section 69-47-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce To Conduct Audits Of Entities Operating Under Provision Of The Mississippi Organic Certification Program; To Bring Forward Section 69-47-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires The Establishment And Payment Of Inspection And Renewal Fees For Certification; To Create New Section 69-47-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Repeal Of The Mississippi Organic Certification Program On July 1, 2016; And For Related Purposes.

1166.title: Anemometer towers; extend repealer on requirement of marking for aviation.
1166.description: An Act To Amend Section 61-19-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On The Requirement Of Markings On Anemometer Towers, Guy Wires And Accessory Facilities For Aviation Purposes From July 1, 2013 To July 1, 2016; And For Related Purposes.

1167.title: Mississippi Individual On-Site Wastewater Disposal System Law; extend repealer on.
1167.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 41-67-1 Through 41-67-29 And 41-67-33 Through 41-67-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Comprise The Mississippi Individual On-site Wastewater Disposal System Law; To Amend Section 41-67-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repeal On The Mississippi Individual On-site Wastewater System Disposal Law; And For Related Purposes.

1168.title: Group purchasing programs by certain public hospitals and regional mental health centers; extend repealer on authority to participate in.
1168.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-7-38, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On The Provision That Authorizes Participation In Group Purchasing Programs By Certain Public Hospitals And Regional Mental Health Centers; And For Related Purposes.

1169.title: Tax sales; extend repealer on provision allowing second sale of property in public improvement district if no bids are received at first sale.
1169.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-41-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On The Provision Of Law That Provides That If Property In A Public Improvement District Is Being Sold For Taxes And Fails To Receive A Bid At A Tax Sale And Is Struck Off To The State, The County Tax Collector, With The Approval Of The Secretary Of State And The Governing Bodies Of The County Or City In Which The Public Improvement District Is Located, May Offer The Property For Sale For A Second Time, And That If There Is No Purchaser Of The Property At The Second Sale, The Property Shall Mature To The State At The Expiration Of The Redemption Period As If No Second Sale Had Occurred; And For Related Purposes.

1170.title: Extracurricular and athletic activities; require students to maintain a 2.0 weekly grade point average for participation.
1170.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-11-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Students In Any Grade Higher Than Grade 6 To Maintain A Weekly Grade Point Average Of 2.0 Or Higher On A 4.0 Scale In Order To Participate In Any Extracurricular Or Athletic Activity During The Week Or The Immediately Approaching Weekend During Which Those Activities Are Conducted; To Authorize Teachers To Temporarily Revoke The Privilege To Participate In Any Extracurricular Or Athletic Activity Of Any Disruptive Student Until The Time That The Student Conforms His Or Her Behavior; To Require The Teacher To Timely Notify The School's Principal And The Sponsor Or Coach Of Those Activities Of The Student's Behavior And The Temporary Revocation Of Participation Privileges; To Provide That Upon The Receipt Of The Notice, The Principal Shall Require The Sponsor Or Coach To Immediately Enforce The Temporary Revocation; And For Related Purposes.

1171.title: State law enforcement officers; not required to use personal or major medical leave when injured in line of duty.
1171.description: An Act To Amend Sections 25-3-93 And 25-3-95, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That State Law Enforcement Officers Who Are Injured By Wound Or Accident In The Line Of Duty Shall Not Be Required To Use Earned Personal Leave Or Major Medical Leave During The Period Of Recovery From The Injury; And For Related Purposes.

1172.title: Mental Health, Department of; employees who are provided housing on facility grounds must pay rent.
1172.description: An Act To Require All Employees Of The State Department Of Mental Health Who Are Provided Housing On The Grounds Of A Hospital Or Other Facility Under The Jurisdiction Of The Department To Pay The Fair Market Rental Value Of The Housing, As Determined By The Department Of Finance And Administration, And Pay The Actual Cost Of The Utilities Used In That Housing By The Employee; To Amend Section 25-11-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Value Of Housing That Is Provided To Employees Of The State Department Of Mental Health On The Grounds Of A Hospital Or Other Facility Under The Jurisdiction Of The Department Shall Not Be Included In The Earned Compensation Of The Employee For The Purposes Of The Public Employees' Retirement System Law; And For Related Purposes.

1173.title: Retirement; exclude value of maintenance furnished to PERS members after 7-1-13 for retirement purposes.
1173.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-11-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Value Of Any Maintenance Furnished To Members Of The Public Employees' Retirement System On Or After July 1, 2013, Shall Not Be Included In The Earned Compensation Of The Members For Retirement Purposes; To Exclude The Value Of Any In-kind Benefits From The Computation Of Earned Compensation; And For Related Purposes.

1174.title: Court reporters; prohibit freelancing.
1174.description: An Act To Amend Sections 9-13-11 And 9-13-118, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Court Reporters Who Are Employees Of The Administrative Office Of Courts From Engaging In Freelance Court Reporting; And For Related Purposes.

1175.title: End-of-course subject area tests; prohibit mandatory passing scores as requirement for graduation.
1175.description: An Act To Prohibit The State Board Of Education From Requiring Students To Achieve A Passing Score On End-of-course Tests Administered Under The Subject Area Testing Program As A Requirement For Graduation; To Amend Section 37-16-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Local School Districts From Using The End-of-course Tests To Determine If Students Have Mastered Minimum Academic Skills Required For Graduation; To Amend Section 37-15-38, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; To Bring Forward Section 37-3-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires The State Department Of Education To Provide An Instructional Program For All Courses In The End-of-course Testing Program, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 37-16-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires School Districts To Offer A Career Track Program, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 37-35-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes School Districts To Establish A General Educational Development (ged) Option Program, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1176.title: Student tutors; require school boards to develop program to incentivize peer-to-peer instruction provided by certain.
1176.description: An Act To Require Local School Boards To Implement A Program Designed To Promote Student Tutors Who Provide Peer-to-peer Instruction; To Require The School Board To Provide A Financial Incentive To Academically Successful Students Who Scored Above Certain Levels On Statewide Assessments And End-of-course Subject Area Tests; To Establish The "peer-to-peer Student Assistance Fund" As A Special Fund In The State Treasury; To Provide For The Appropriation And Deposit Of Funds Into The Fund For The Purpose Of Carrying Out The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1177.title: Health insurance; allow parent access to child's medical records if covered under his or her policy or plan.
1177.description: An Act To Allow Parents Or Legal Guardians To Access Medical Records Of Children Who Are Covered Under Their Health Insurance Policy Or Plan; And For Related Purposes.

1178.title: Law enforcement; require administrative leave while officer is investigated for committing crime against person.
1178.description: An Act To Require Law Enforcement Officers Accused Of Crimes Against Another Person To Be Placed On Administrative Leave; And For Related Purposes.

1179.title: Charter schools; create a pilot program for girls in Grades 3 through 12.
1179.description: An Act To Create A Charter School Pilot Program For Girls In Grades 3 Through 12; To Authorize Charter Schools To Be Formed In "d" Or "f" School Districts Selected By The State Board Of Education By Creating A New School Or By Conversion Of A Public School To Charter Status; To Prescribe Certain Requirements For Charter Schools; To Establish Admission Requirements And Powers And Duties Of Charter Schools; To Specify The Terms Required For A School's Charter; To Establish The Process For Applying For Charter School Status; To Require The Automatic Renewal Of Charters; To Provide That Charter Schools Are Exempt From All Education Statutes, Unless Stated Otherwise, And Rules And Regulations Of The State Board Of Education Or The Local School District; To Provide For The Employment Of Teachers And Substitute Teachers By Charter Schools; To Prohibit Unlawful Reprisals Against School District Employees Who Are Involved In An Application For Charter School Status; To Provide For State And Local Funding Of Charter Schools; To Authorize The School District To Lease Space To Charter Schools; To Require Charter Schools To Have A Transportation Plan; To Require The State Board Of Education To Seek Funding From Various Sources To Enhance The Charter School Pilot Program; To Provide For The Election Of The Board Of Directors Of A Charter School; To Prohibit Charter Schools From Levying Taxes Or Issuing Bonds Secured By Tax Revenues; To Require All Applications For Charter Schools To Be Submitted To The State Department Of Education Before December 1 In The School Year Preceding The First School Year The Charter School Intends To Open; To Require The State Department Of Education To Submit An Evaluation Of The Charter Schools To The Legislature; And For Related Purposes.

1180.title: Energy Infrastructure Revolving Loan Fund; increase period allotted to issue bonds allocated for.
1180.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-40-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "project" As Used In The Energy Infrastructure Revolving Loan Program; To Amend Section 57-40-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Fund May Be Used To Assist Energy-providing Utilities; To Amend Sections 57-40-5 And 57-40-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Amend Chapter 557, Laws Of 2009 To Extend Until July 1, 2016, The Date Which Bonds Authorized Under The Energy Infrastructure Revolving Loan Program May Be Issued; And For Related Purposes.

1181.title: Nutrition labeling of food; reserve regulation of to the Legislature.
1181.description: An Act To Reserve To The Legislature Any Regulation Of Consumer Incentive Items And Nutrition Labeling Of Food And Nonalcoholic Beverages That Are Menu Items In Restaurants, Food Establishments, And Vending Machines; To Prohibit Political Subdivisions From Taking Certain Actions Relating To Providing Food Nutrition Information At Food Service Operations; To Specify That This Act Will Not Affect The Federal Regulation Of Nutrition Labeling Of Food Under Existing Federal Law; And For Related Purposes.

1182.title: State airplanes; authorize DFA to purchase liability insurance for.
1182.description: An Act To Amend Section 61-13-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Provision That Prohibits The Department Of Finance And Administration From Purchasing Liability Insurance For Any Nonmilitary Airplanes Owned Or Operated By The State Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1183.title: Medicaid; reduce hospital assessment if hospital closes inpatient specialty beds or services.
1183.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-145, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Hospital Assessment For Medicaid Funding Purposes Shall Not Be Applied To Non-medicare Hospital Inpatient Days For Inpatient Psychiatric Services Provided By Nonstate Government Hospitals Licensed By The State Department Of Health To Operate Inpatient Psychiatric Beds; To Provide That If A Hospital Subject To The Assessment Closes Or Ceases To Operate Inpatient Specialty Beds Or Services That Are Recognized By The State Department Of Health As A Separate Licensure Category Of Beds, Then That Hospital's Assessment For The State Fiscal Year In Which The Specialty Beds Or Services Are Closed Or Cease To Operate Shall Be Adjusted On A Pro Rata Basis To Reflect The Number Of Days The Specialty Service Was Not In Service During The State Fiscal Year For Which The Assessment Is Being Assessed; To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On This Section; And For Related Purposes.

1185.title: MS Debt Management Services Act; extend repealer on.
1185.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 81-22-1 Through 81-22-28, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Debt Management Services Act; To Amend Section 81-22-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On The Act; And For Related Purposes.

1186.title: EpiPens; require all public schools to keep onsite.
1186.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-79-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require All Public Schools To Keep Auto-injectable Epinephrine Onsite; To Authorize Schools To Make Auto-injectable Epinephrine Available To Students Entitled To Possess And Self-administer The Medication At School; To Authorize School Personnel To Administer Auto-injectable Epinephrine To A Student For Whom Anaphylaxis Medication Has Not Been Prescribed If The Student Has An Anaphylactic Adverse Reaction; To Grant Immunity To School Districts And School Personnel Administering Or Choosing Not To Administer Unprescribed Auto-injectable Epinephrine; And For Related Purposes.

1187.title: Scenic byways; designate certain scenic byways in Madison County.
1187.description: An Act To Designate Certain Segments Of Highways In Madison County As An Official Mississippi Scenic Byway To Be Known As The "gateway To History"; To Designate Segments Of Highways Existing In The Cities Of Madison And Canton, And The Town Of Flora, As The "gateway To History"; And For Related Purposes.

1188.title: Easements on public lands; expand Secretary of State's authority to convey for energy products and utilities.
1188.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-1-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Secretary Of State's Authority To Grant Easements Over Public Lands For Lines, Fixtures And Other Transmission Apparatus For Utility And Energy Purposes; To Amend Section 29-1-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Preceding Provisions; To Bring Forward Section 29-1-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Places Restrictions On The Construction And Use Of Pipelines Across Public Lands, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1189.title: Constables; provide fees to be paid to by complaining party when service of process cannot be completed on defendant.
1189.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-11-20, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That When Suit Is Filed In Justice Court, The Clerk Of The Justice Court Shall Notify The Complaining Party That They Owe A Fee To The Constable Of The County Where The Suit Was Originally Filed When The Constable, After Diligent Search And Inquiry, Is Unable To Complete The Service Of Process Because The Defendant Resides In Another County; To Amend Section 25-7-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Such Fee To The Constable; And For Related Purposes.

1190.title: Law enforcement officers; require periodic drug testing by outside company.
1190.description: An Act To Require Periodic Drug Testing Of Law Enforcement Officers As Determined By The Attorney General; To Require Bidding For The Contract To Perform Such Testing; To Authorize The Attorney General To Promulgate Rules And Regulations To Carry Out The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1191.title: DHS; prohibit removal of students from school without first giving notice of removal to parents.
1191.description: An Act To Prohibit The Department Of Human Services From Removing A Student From School Or Educational Facility Without First Providing Notice Of Such Removal To The Child's Parent Or Legal Guardian; And For Related Purposes.

1192.title: Vehicle searches; prohibit without physical or visual evidence of violation of law.
1192.description: An Act To Prohibit Vehicle Searches Of Motor Vehicles Without Actual Physical Or Visual Evidence Of A Violation Of State Law; And For Related Purposes.

1193.title: Law enforcement; require record keeping of out-of-state homicides.
1193.description: An Act To Require Law Enforcement Agencies To Maintain Records Of Reported Homicides From Other States And The United States; And For Related Purposes.

1194.title: Sentencing; create standard for felonies.
1194.description: An Act To Provide That No Judge Shall Reduce The Statutory Minimum Imposed For Any Felony Offense; And For Related Purposes.

1195.title: Drug testing; authorize for persons receiving public assistance benefits.
1195.description: An Act To Provide That Recipients Of Public Assistance Benefits Who Are 13 Years Of Age Or Older Shall Be Subject To Taking A Drug Test On A Random Basis To Determine Their Eligibility To Continue Receiving The Benefits; To Provide That If A Recipient Is Given A Drug Test And He Or She Tests Positive For Any Prohibited Drug, The Recipient Must Receive Treatment For Substance Abuse Through A Community Mental Health Center Or A Local Medical Provider; To Provide That The Recipient Will Remain Eligible To Continue Receiving The Benefits While Receiving The Substance Abuse Treatment; To Require The Recipient To Present Documented Proof From A Community Mental Health Center Or A Local Medical Provider, Not Later Than 90 Days After Testing Positive For A Drug, That He Or She Is Free From Substance Abuse In Order To Continue Receiving The Benefits; To Provide That If The Recipient Does Not Present Documented Proof That He Or She Is Free From Substance Within The Prescribed Time, The Recipient Shall Not Be Eligible To Receive The Benefits For A Period Of Not Less Than 90 Days; To Provide That After That Period, A Person May Reapply To Receive Public Assistance Benefits, And Will Be Eligible To Receive The Benefits Again If The Person Passes Another Drug Test; To Direct The Mississippi Department Of Human Services, In Conjunction With The Bureau Of Narcotics And The State Department Of Health, To Establish And Administer A Testing Program With Such Standards And Procedures Deemed Necessary To Accomplish The Requirements Of This Act; To Provide That All Testing Required Under This Act Shall Be Performed At The Mississippi Crime Laboratory Or At A Laboratory Approved By The Director Of The Mississippi Crime Laboratory; To Amend Sections 43-13-115 And 43-17-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1196.title: Adoption; revise fines for illegal placement.
1196.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-15-123, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Fine Imposed For Illegal Placement Of Children; And For Related Purposes.

1197.title: Unemployment benefits; prohibit charging experience rating of employers for payment of employees who leave to accept other work.
1197.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-5-355, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Benefits Paid To An Eligible Individual Shall Not Be Charged Against The Experience Rating Of An Employer, If The Employee Leaves The Employ Of An Employer To Accept Other Work; And For Related Purposes.

1198.title: Juries; prohibit friends and family of victim or defendant from serving.
1198.description: An Act To Amend Section 13-5-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Family Or Friends Of A Victim Or Defendant From Being Jurors In Proceedings Involving The Victim Or Defendant; And For Related Purposes.

1199.title: Right to appeal; include in Victims' Bill of Rights.
1199.description: An Act To Create The Broderick Dixon Act; To Amend Section 99-43-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Rights Of The Victim Shall Include The Right To Appeal; And For Related Purposes.

1200.title: Law enforcement officers; require psychological evaluation every two years.
1200.description: An Act To Require Law Enforcement Officers To Undergo A Psychological Evaluation Every Two Years; To Authorize The Attorney General To Promulgate Rules And Regulations To Carry Out The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1201.title: Toll roads; establish on I-20, I-55 and Hwy 49 and allocate fees to each county proportionately.
1201.description: An Act To Amend Sections 65-43-1 And 65-43-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Interstate 20, Interstate 55 And United States Highway 49 To Be Established As Toll Roads; And For Related Purposes.

1202.title: Law enforcement officers; require universal background check for applicants for employment.
1202.description: An Act To Require Certain Testing And Background Checks For All Applicants Seeking Employment As A Law Enforcement Officer; And For Related Purposes.

1203.title: Municipal Tort Claims; revise immunity for damage to vehicle.
1203.description: An Act To Provide That Any Person Whose Motor Vehicle Tires Are Damaged In Any Manner By Severely Damaged Municipal Roads Shall Be Able To Bring Suit; To Amend Section 11-46-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove Liabilities From The List Of Actions That Are Immune From Tort Claims; And For Related Purposes.

1204.title: Gun sales; prohibit sale of stolen.
1204.description: An Act To Prohibit The Sale Of Stolen Firearms; To Provide Penalties For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

1205.title: Crisis intervention centers; require to establish one in Hinds County, and direct Legislature to fully fund all centers.
1205.description: An Act To Direct The State Department Of Mental Health To Establish A Crisis Intervention Center In Hinds County; To Direct The Legislature To Appropriate Sufficient Funds To The Department Annually For The Department To Be Able To Contract With Suitable Entities To Provide Proper Staffing And Services For All Of The Beds In Each Of The Crisis Intervention Centers; And For Related Purposes.

1206.title: Law enforcement officers; prohibit from using weapons, radio devices or motor vehicles owned by government entities except for official business.
1206.description: An Act To Make It Unlawful For Any Law Enforcement Officer To Possess, Use, Or Permit Or Authorize The Use Of A Weapon Owned By The State Of Mississippi Or A Political Subdivision Thereof Except Upon Official Business; To Make It Unlawful For Any Law Enforcement Officer To Use Or Permit Or Authorize The Use Of Any Automobile Or Any Other Motor Vehicle Owned By The State Of Mississippi Or A Political Subdivision Thereof Except Upon Official Business; To Provide Penalties For Certain Violations Of Those Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

1207.title: Cosmetology Board; require to issue photo ID to licensees to display at place of employment.
1207.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-7-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Each License Issued By The State Board Of Cosmetology Shall Contain A Head Photograph Of The License Holder, The Person's Name, And The Type Of License Held By The Person; And For Related Purposes.

1208.title: Public schools; require student wellness be included as component of curriculum.
1208.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-134, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Student Wellness Shall Be Included As An Individual Educational Component Of School Districts' Curriculum In The Public Schools Of This State; To Allow School Boards To Review And Certify National Health And Wellness Programs And Solicit Free Literature From Various Nationally Recognized Programs That Is Most Age And Grade Appropriate For The School Districts' Needs; To Require Individuals Employed By School Districts To Provide Instruction Of Student Wellness To Be Certified In Any Area Of Health And Wellness And To Present Proof Of Certification To The Board At Time Of Employment; To Exempt That Individual From The Certification Requirements Of Section 37-3-2; To Amend Section 37-3-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; To Bring Forward Sections 37-13-131, 37-13-133, 37-13-135 And 37-161-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For The Purpose Of Possible Amendments; And For Related Purposes.

1209.title: Law enforcement review board; require each municipality to create.
1209.description: An Act To Require The Governing Authorities Of Each Municipality To Create A Law Enforcement Review Board; To Provide The Purposes For Such Board; To Provide That No Officer, Relative Of A Law Enforcement Officer Or Any Employee Of The Municipality Shall Be Appointed To Such Board; To Authorize The Governing Authorities To Pay The Members Of The Board In An Amount Not To Exceed Forty Dollars; And For Related Purposes.

1210.title: Road repairs; require counties and municipalities to repair with employees of the governmental entity.
1210.description: An Act To Amend Sections 21-37-4, 65-7-81, 65-7-83, 65-7-85 And 65-7-95, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require That Road Repair Work Be Performed By Employees Of The Governmental Entity Performing Such Work; And For Related Purposes.

1211.title: Law enforcement; provide for electronic citations for certain offenses.
1211.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-9-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Authenticity Of An Electronic Citation; And For Related Purposes.

1212.title: Volunteer fire departments; increase amount insurance company required to pay for response to fire.
1212.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-13-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Minimum Amount An Insurance Company Is Required To Pay A Volunteer Fire Department For Each Initial Response To Save Certain Structures From Destruction By Fire; And For Related Purposes.

1213.title: Constables; establish compensation of those who serve as bailiffs.
1213.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-19-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish The Compensation Of A Constable Who Serves As A Bailiff; And For Related Purposes.

1214.title: Bonds; extend authority to issue for certain capital improvements.
1214.description: An Act To Amend Section 1, Chapter 557, Laws Of 2009, To Extend Until July 1, 2015, The Authority To Issue State General Obligation Bonds For Certain Capital Improvements; And For Related Purposes.

1215.title: Commission on Marine Resources; authorize to consent to federal aid legislation to ensure continuation of federal funds for marine conservation.
1215.description: An Act To Provide The State Assent To Federal Aid Legislation To Ensure The Conservation Of Marine Resources; To Provide That Revenue From Marine Fishing License Sales Shall Be Under The Exclusive Control Of The Commission On Marine Resources For The Sole Use Of The Management Of The State's Fish And Marine Resources; And For Related Purposes.

1216.title: Oakley Youth Development Center; establish process to convert to a public charter school.
1216.description: An Act To Authorize The Mississippi Department Of Human Services And The State Department Of Education To Enter Into Agreement For The Conversion Of The Oakley Youth Development Center To A Conversion Charter School; To Prescribe For The Enrollment Of Student Adjudicated By The Court As Delinquent Or Those Children With Such Abhorrent Behavior, Special Needs As Defined Under Idea, Emotional Instabilities, Academic Deficiencies Or Severe Record Of School Suspension Or Expulsion That Renders The Child Incapable Of Receiving Instruction In A Traditional Public School Environment; To Amend Sections 37-165-5, 37-165-7, 37-165-9, 37-165-17 And 43-21-605, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Preceding Provisions; To Bring Forward Sections 37-165-1, 37-165-3, 37-165-11, 37-165-13, 37-165-15, 37-165-19, 37-165-21, 37-165-23, 37-165-25 And 37-165-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1217.title: Honey bees; include sales by producers of in the list of agricultural products exempt from sales tax.
1217.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include The Sales By Producers Of Honey Bees Or Other Products Of Apiaries In The List Of Agricultural Products Exempt From Sales Tax; And For Related Purposes.

1218.title: Appropriation; Department of Education for North Pike School District to construct and equip a vo-tech building.
1218.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The State Department Of Education For The Purpose Of Providing Funding To The North Pike School District For The Construction And Equipping Of A Vocational-technical Education Building For The Fiscal Year 2014.

1219.title: Mental Health; reconstitute membership of board and revise qualifications of executive director.
1219.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-4-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reconstitute The Membership Of The State Board Of Mental Health; To Amend Section 41-4-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Qualifications For The Executive Director Of The State Department Of Mental Health; To Provide That The Person Serving As Executive Director Of The Department On The Effective Date Of This Act Shall Be Removed From Office On The Last Day Of The Month After The Effective Date Of This Act, And The Board Shall Appoint A Person To Serve As Interim Executive Director Until A New Permanent Executive Director Is Appointed; To Extend The Date Of The Repealers On Certain Provisions Of This Section; And For Related Purposes.

1220.title: Immigration status; strengthen enforcement of E-verify law.
1220.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-11-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Penalties And Enforcement Authority Under The Employment Protection Act; And For Related Purposes.

1221.title: Public benefits; deny to any person not lawfully present in the United States.
1221.description: An Act To Require Adult Applicants For State, Local Or Federal Public Benefits In Mississippi To Verify United States Citizenship Or Lawful Presence In The United States In Order To Be Eligible For The Benefits; To Require State Agencies And Political Subdivisions To Verify The Lawful Presence In The United States Of Any Person Who Applies For State, Local Or Federal Public Benefits; To Provide For Certain Exceptions To This Requirement For Verification; To Provide That Applicants For Public Benefits Must Execute An Affidavit That He Or She Is A United States Citizen Or Is A Qualified Alien Under Federal Law And Is Lawfully Present In The United States; To Provide For A Criminal Penalty For Willfully Making A False Statement Of Representation In The Affidavit Required By This Act; To Require Each State Agency And Political Subdivision That Administers Any Program Of State Or Local Public Benefits To Provide An Annual Report To The Attorney General With Respect To Its Compliance With This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1222.title: Public benefits; require applicants for to provide certain ID and execute affidavit of lawful presence in U.S.
1222.description: An Act To Be Known As The "proof Of Citizenship For Receipt Of Public Benefits Act"; To Require Persons Who Apply Directly To A State Or Local Agency For Public Benefits To Provide Certain Forms Of Identification To The Agency And To Execute An Affidavit Stating That The Person Is A United States Citizen Or Legal Permanent Resident Or Is Otherwise Lawfully Present In The United States Under Federal Law; To Provide For Certain Exceptions To Those Requirements; To Require Agencies That Administer Public Benefits To Verify, Through The Systematic Alien Verification Of Entitlement (save) Program Operated By The Department Of Homeland Security, That Each Noncitizen Applicant Who Has Executed An Affidavit Is An Alien Legally Present In The United States; To Provide For A Criminal Penalty For Directly Applying To An Agency For Public Benefits In Violation Of The Requirements Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1225.title: Alcoholic beverages; impose a handling fee on alcoholic beverages placed in the ABC's liquor distribution center warehouse.
1225.description: An Act To Impose A Handling Fee On Each Manufacturer Or Wholesaler Of Alcoholic Beverages Whose Product Is Placed In The Department Of Revenue's Liquor Distribution Center; To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury Designated As The Abc Capital Expenditure Fund And To Provide That Revenue Derived From The Handling Fee Shall Be Placed In Such Fund; To Provide That Money In The Fund May Be Utilized By The Department Of Revenue For Any Expenditure Necessary For The Operations Of The Department's Liquor Distribution Center And Grounds; To Provide That When Money In The Abc Capital Expenditure Fund Is Insufficient To Cover The Expenditures Necessary For The Operations Of The Liquor Distribution Center, The Department Of Revenue May Borrow Additional Funds And Repayment Of The Loans Shall Be Made From The Fund; To Amend Section 27-71-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1226.title: Crime victims; authorize to employ private attorney to prosecute case as alternative to DA's office.
1226.description: An Act To Authorize Crime Victims To Employ Private Attorneys To Prosecute Criminal Cases; And For Related Purposes.

1227.title: Courthouses; allow members of the Legislature to carry personal belongings into courtroom proceedings.
1227.description: An Act To Authorize Legislators To Carry Certain Personal Items Into A Courtroom; And For Related Purposes.

1228.title: Motor vehicles; revise laws to state that not using seat belt may be admissible as evidence to prove failure to mitigate.
1228.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-2-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Certain Laws Regarding Motor Vehicles To State That Failure To Provide And Use A Seat Belt Restraint Device Or System May Be Admissible In Evidence To Prove A Failure To Mitigate Damages; And For Related Purposes.

1229.title: Mississippi Consumer Choice in Uninsured Motorist Coverage Act; create.
1229.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Consumer Choice In Uninsured Motorist Coverage Act; To Amend Section 83-11-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Motor Vehicle Owners The Option Of Knowingly Purchasing An Economic-only Policy Of Uninsured Motorist Bodily Injury Liability Coverage Instead Of The Traditional Coverage; To Exclude Certain Coverage From The Uninsured Motorist Property Damage Liability Coverage; To Bring Forward Sections 83-11-102, 83-11-103, 83-11-105, 83-11-107, 83-11-109 And 83-11-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Regard Uninsured Motorist Coverage, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1230.title: Truth in Sentencing Task Force; create.
1230.description: An Act To Create The Corrections And Criminal Justice Task Force To Study The Divide Between The State's Corrections System And Criminal Justice System; To Provide For The Membership Of The Task Force; To Prescribe The Duties Of The Task Force Members; And For Related Purposes.

1231.title: Ad valorem tax; authorize partial exemption for agricultural land that is converted to a residential use.
1231.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of A County And/or The Governing Authorities Of A Municipality To Grant A Partial Ad Valorem Tax Exemption For Agricultural Property That Is Being Converted To A Residential Use In An Amount Equal To The Difference Between The Assessed Value Of The Property For Agricultural Use And The Assessed Value Of The Property For Residential Use; To Provide That The Exemption Shall End When The Property Is Occupied By A Homeowner; To Provide The Manner In Which A Request For Such Exemption Must Be Made; And For Related Purposes.

1232.title: S.A.F.E. Mortgage Act; violation of limitation on owner financing of residential mortgage loans will not affect title.
1232.description: An Act To Amend Section 81-18-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Violation Of The Exemption From The Mississippi S.a.f.e. Mortgage Act For Persons Who Owner Finance Not More Than Ten Residential Mortgage Loans In One Year Will Not Affect The Title Of The Purchaser/borrower Or The Obligation Of The Purchaser/borrower Under The Terms Of The Mortgage Loan; And For Related Purposes.

1233.title: State health insurance; require same co-pay/deductible for prescription drugs whether obtained from retail pharmacy or by mail order.
1233.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-15-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Health Insurance Program Of The State And School Employees Life And Health Insurance Plan Shall Require That The Prescription Drug Coverage Under The Plan Provides That The Co-payment And Deductible Amounts Required For Prescription Drugs Obtained From A Retail Pharmacy Shall Be The Same As The Co-payment And Deductible Amounts Required For The Same Prescription Drugs Obtained Through A Mail Order Pharmacy Service; And For Related Purposes.

1234.title: Sales tax; reduce rate on retail sales of motorcycles.
1234.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Sales Tax Rate On Retail Sales Of Motorcycles From Seven Percent To Five Percent; And For Related Purposes.

1235.title: Municipalities; clarify the authority to hire full-time and part-time attorney as a municipal employee.
1235.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-15-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That A Municipality May Employ A Full-time Or Part-time Attorney; And For Related Purposes.

1236.title: Counties; authorize board of supervisors to employ attorney as full-time county employee.
1236.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-3-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Authority Of The Board Of Supervisors Of Any County To Employ An Attorney As A Full-time County Employee; To Amend Section 19-23-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The County Prosecuting Attorney May Not Be Employed By The Board Of Supervisors As The Full-time County Attorney; To Amend Section 19-3-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Previous Section And For Related Purposes.

1237.title: County and state executive committees; prohibit those who violate the public trust from serving on.
1237.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-263, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Person Who Violates The Public's Trust Shall Be Disqualified From Serving On Any County Executive Committee; To Amend Section 23-15-1053, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit A Person Who Has Violated The Public's Trust From Serving On A State Or County Executive Committee; To Provide Penalties For Serving On An Executive Committee After Violation Of The Public's Trust; To Amend Section 23-15-1054, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit A Person Who Has Violated The Public's Trust From Serving On A Temporary County Executive Committee; And For Related Purposes.

1238.title: State Health Insurance; require same co-pay/deductible for prescription drugs whether obtained for retail pharmacy or by mail order.
1238.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-15-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Health Insurance Program Of The State And School Employees Life And Health Insurance Plan Shall Require That The Prescription Drug Coverage Under The Plan Provide That The Co-payment And Deductible Amounts Required For Prescription Drugs Obtained From A Retail Pharmacy Shall Be The Same As The Co-payment And Deductible Amounts Required For The Same Prescription Drugs Obtained Through A Mail Order Pharmacy Service; And For Related Purposes.

1239.title: Temporary license tag; authorize motor vehicle dealers to issue when vehicle is purchased.
1239.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of A Temporary License Tag By A Motor Vehicle Dealer To The Purchaser Of A Motor Vehicle At The Time Of The Sale; To Require The Department Of Revenue To Design The Temporary License Tag And To Prescribe Certain Information That Must Be Included On The Tag; To Require Each Temporary License Tag To Expire 30 Days From The Date Of The Vehicle's Purchase; To Require A Dealer Who Issues Temporary License Tags To Maintain Certain Records Relating To The Issuance Of Each Tag; To Require An Additional Fee To Be Paid To The Dealer For The Issuance Of A Temporary License Tag; To Require Dealers To Remit Fees To The County Of Residence Of The Vehicle's Purchaser; To Prohibit Dealers From Using Temporary License Tags For Any Reason Other Than The Intended Purpose; And For Related Purposes.

1240.title: Child support; provide credit toward payment upon presentation of receipts to DHS and the court.
1240.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-11-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Credit Toward Child Support Obligations Upon Presentation Of Receipts To The Department Of Human Services And The Court; And For Related Purposes.

1241.title: Child support; suspend requirement for payment while payor is incarcerated.
1241.description: An Act To Amend Sections 93-11-65 And 93-11-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Duty To Pay Child Support Shall Be Suspended While The Payor Is Incarcerated; And For Related Purposes.

1242.title: State agencies; require to provide legislative update section on their websites.
1242.description: An Act To Require State Agencies And Departments To Include On Their Internet Websites A Separate Section That Provides A Legislative Update On Any Legislation Enacted At The Legislative Session That Revises The Powers And Duties Of The Agency Or Department, Within Sixty Days After The End Of The Legislative Session; And For Related Purposes.

1243.title: Bonds; allow for obligor incarcerated for overdue child support.
1243.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-11-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Bail For Obligors Incarcerated For Overdue Child Support; And For Related Purposes.

1244.title: School board members; require all to be elected at time of presidential election.
1244.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-5-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Election Of Members Of The County Boards Of Education At The Same Time As The Presidential Election And To Establish A Term Of Four Years For That Office; To Amend Section 37-5-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Section 37-7-207, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Election Of Members Of The Boards Of Trustees Of Consolidated School Districts And Line Consolidated School Districts In The Same Manner And At The Same Time As The Presidential Election And To Establish A Term Of Four Years For Those Offices; To Amend Section 37-7-713, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Election Of Members Of The Boards Of Trustees Of Certain Special Municipal Separate School Districts In The Same Manner And At The Same Time As The Presidential Election And To Establish A Term Of Four Years For That Office; To Repeal Sections 37-7-221, 37-7-223, 37-7-227 And 37-7-229, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Certain Methods For Electing Trustees Of Consolidated And Line Consolidated School Districts; To Repeal Sections 37-7-705, 37-7-707, 37-7-709, 37-7-711, 37-7-715 And 37-7-717, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Certain Methods For Selecting Trustees Of Special Municipal Separate School Districts; And For Related Purposes.

1245.title: Surveillance cameras; authorize use of in classrooms and other areas of alternative schools.
1245.description: An Act To Require School Districts To Install Surveillance Cameras Equipped With Audio Reception Technology In Certain Areas Of Alternative Schools; To Authorize The School District To Contract With Any Company Or Individual, Independent Of The School District, To Provide Surveillance Monitoring Service; To Require The School District, Acting Through The Local School Board To Employ Certain Procedures Prior To Awarding The Contract For Monitoring Services; To Exclude The Need For School Districts To Employ Security Personnel Or Require The Immediate Presence Of Law Enforcement Officers On School Premises Equipped With Surveillance Cameras; To Bring Forward Section 37-3-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Possible Amendments; And For Related Purposes.

1246.title: Public Schools; require surveillance video in each classroom and certain other areas of the school facility.
1246.description: An Act To Require School Districts To Install Surveillance Cameras Equipped With Audio Reception Technology In All Classrooms And Certain Other Areas Of School Facilities; To Authorize The School District To Contract With Any Company Or Individual, Independent Of The School District To Provide Surveillance Monitoring Service; To Require The School District, Acting Through The Local School Board To Employ Certain Procedures Prior To Awarding The Contract For Monitoring Services; To Require That The Parent Or Legal Guardian Of A Student Detained For Questioning For Certain Actions Be Informed Of The Detainment Before The Questioning Begins; To Exclude The Need For School Districts To Employ Security Personnel Or Require The Immediate Presence Of Law Enforcement Officer On School Premises Equipped With Surveillance Cameras; To Bring Forward Section 37-3-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Possible Amendments; And For Related Purposes.

1247.title: Human trafficking; revise and enhance penalties for.
1247.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-54, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Title Of The Human Trafficking Act For Clarity; To Amend Section 97-3-54.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Penalties For Human Trafficking And Specify Additional Elements Of The Offense Of Human Trafficking; To Amend Section 97-3-54.3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Amend Section 97-3-54.4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Definitions; To Create New Section 97-3-54.5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Use Of Undercover Operatives To Investigate Suspected Human Trafficking; To Create New Section 97-3-54.6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Injunctive And Other Relief For Victims And To Require Confidentiality; To Create New Section 97-3-54.7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Forfeiture Of Assets Used In Furtherance Of Trafficking And To Provide For The Disposition Of Proceeds Of Forfeiture; To Create New Section 97-3-54.8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The "relief For Victims Of Human Trafficking Fund"; To Create New Section 97-3-54.9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The Position Of Statewide Human Trafficking Coordinator; To Amend Section 97-29-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Elements And Punishment For The Offense Of Prostitution; To Amend Section 97-29-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Elements And Punishment For The Offense Of Soliciting Prostitution; To Repeal Section 97-29-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Set Forth The Punishment For Prostitution And Solicitation; To Amend Section 97-43-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Definitions In The Racketeering Act; To Amend Sections 97-5-5 And 97-5-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Offenses Of Enticement Of A Minor To The Tenor Of This Act; To Amend Section 97-5-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform Dissemination Of Sexually Oriented Material; To Amend Section 97-5-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Offense Of Computer-luring; To Amend Section 99-1-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Statute Of Limitations For The Prosecution Of Human Trafficking Cases; And For Related Purposes.

1248.title: Motor carriers; conform code sections to reflect prior transfer of duties of the PSC to the MS Transportation Commission.
1248.description: An Act To Amend Motor Carriers Laws To Reflect The Prior Transfer Of The Duties Of The Public Service Commission To The Mississippi Transportation Commission; To Amend Sections 77-7-7, 77-7-21, 77-7-23, 77-7-55, 77-7-115, 77-7-119, 77-7-125, 77-7-127, 77-7-333, 77-7-335, 77-7-337 And 77-7-339, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Amend Sections 77-9-5, 77-9-119, 77-9-489 And 77-9-605, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Prior Transfer Of The Duties Of The Public Service Commission Related To Railroads To The Mississippi Transportation Commission; And For Related Purposes.

1249.title: Elected officials; indictment results in suspension without pay and conviction results in removal.
1249.description: An Act To Provide That An Elected Official Who Is Indicted For Certain Crimes In State Or Federal Court Shall Be Suspended Immediately Without Pay; To Specify The Crimes Which Result In Such Suspension; To Provide That If An Elected Official Is Convicted Of Such A Crime, He Shall Be Removed From Office; To Amend Section 25-5-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1250.title: Contractors; prohibit deposit or cashing of a joint check agreement without authorization of all signees.
1250.description: An Act To Prohibit A Contractor From Depositing Or Cashing A Payment Made By A Joint Check Agreement Without Authorization From All Signees; To Provide Penalties For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

1251.title: Bad check law; revise.
1251.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-19-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Bad Check Law; And For Related Purposes.

1252.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for portion of costs paid by a business enterprise to expand and relocate employees to this state.
1252.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-73-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Any Permanent Business Enterprise That Expands Its Labor Forces Into The State Of Mississippi From Outside The State Of Mississippi; To Provide For The Amount Of The Credit; To Provide That A Company May Not Receive A Credit In An Amount Greater Than $1,000,000.00 For Any One Taxable Year, And That The Maximum Cumulative Amount Of Tax Credits That May Be Claimed By All Taxpayers Claiming A Credit Under This Act In Any One State Fiscal Year Shall Not Exceed $3,000,000.00, Exclusive Of Credits That Might Be Carried Forward From Previous Taxable Years; To Provide That A Tax Credit Claimed Under This Act But Not Used In A Taxable Year May Be Carried Forward For Five Years From The Close Of The Tax Year In Which The Relocation Costs Were Paid; To Amend Sections 57-87-3, 57-87-5, 57-87-7 And 27-111-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1253.title: "Conditional Post-Conviction Release Act"; create.
1253.description: An Act To Create The "conditional Post-conviction Release Act"; To Provide Certain Definitions; To Provide That When An Individual Is Released Early From Incarceration Such Inmate May Be Required To Post An Early Release Bond That Is Backed By A Surety; To Authorize The Releasing Authority To Set Certain Conditions For Release As Part Of The Bond; To Provide Certain Terms For The Early Release Bond; To Require That A Surety Pay Certain Breach Penalties If An Individual Breaches Certain Conditions; To Authorize The Surety To Arrest Such Individual If He Or She Breaches The Conditions Of Release; To Amend Sections 47-7-5 And 47-7-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1254.title: Dental insurance; require State Designated Dental Insurance Plan as option for state employees.
1254.description: An Act To Require The Department Of Finance And Administration To Utilize A Competitive Request For Proposals Process To Select A State Designated Dental Insurance Plan; To Require Each State Agency Or Commission, School District, Community/junior College District And Public Library To Make Available To All Of Its Employees The State Designated Dental Insurance Plan On And After October 1, 2013, In Addition To Any Other Dental Insurance Plan The Employer May Choose To Make Available To Its Employees; And For Related Purposes.

1255.title: State Auditor; revise provisions regarding organization and staffing of departments.
1255.description: An Act To Amend Section 7-7-203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Provision Of Law Regarding The Organization Of The Office Of The State Auditor; To Provide That There Will Be A Financial And Compliance Division And An Investigations Division, Each With A Director; To Provide That The Auditor May Appoint Or Employ Professionals And Assistants, Or Contract For Services, As Necessary To Carry Out The Duties Of The Auditor; To Eliminate The Requirement That Administrative, Technical And Professional Assistants Be Qualified Under A Merit System Established By The Auditor; To Delete The Restriction That The Auditor May Not Discharge Any Employee Covered By The Merit System, Except For Certain Acts Committed In Violation Of The Merit System; And For Related Purposes.

1256.title: School nutrition; require school districts to serve low-fat meals and snacks to students diagnosed as overweight.
1256.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-137, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Board Of Education To Adopt A Regulation Requiring Local School Districts To Provide Low-fat Snacks And Meals To Children Diagnosed By A Physician As Overweight And To Children Whose Parents Request Only Low-fat Snacks And Meals For Their Children; To Require The State Board Of Education To Adopt A Regulation Addressing Food Sales Outside Of The Child Nutrition School Breakfast And Lunch Programs Which Are Made Available At The Discretion Of The Local School District; And For Related Purposes.

1257.title: Public property; authorize Transportation Commission to donate certain to City of Canton and revise state highway system accordingly.
1257.description: An Act To Authorize The Mississippi Transportation Commission To Transfer And Convey By Mode Of Donation To The City Of Canton, Mississippi, All Of The Rights, Title And Interest In Certain Real Property Located In Madison County, Mississippi; To Delete A Segment Of Mississippi 16 Between U.s. 51 And Mississippi 43 In The City Of Canton From The State Highway System And Return It To The Jurisdiction Of The Mayor And Board Of Aldermen Of The City Of Canton; To Add A Certain Segment Of Newly Constructed Highway Between U.s. 51 And Mississippi 43 In The City Of Canton To The State Highway System To Be Designated As A Part Of Mississippi 16 In Madison County; And For Related Purposes.

1258.title: Child abuse; revise elements of felony offense of.
1258.description: An Act To Be Known As The Lonnie Smith Act; To Amend Section 97-5-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Elements Of The Offense Of Felonious Child Abuse; And For Related Purposes.

1259.title: Wild hog control; add to the beaver control program and revise composition and change nomenclature of the advisory board.
1259.description: An Act To Amend Sections 49-7-201 And 49-7-203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Add The Control Or Eradication Of Wild Hogs To The Beaver Control Program; To Provide That State Funds May Be Expended For Wild Hog Control Only By A Specific Line-item Appropriation By The Legislature For That Purpose; To Revise The Composition Of The Beaver Control Advisory Board, To Add The Chairmen Of The House And Senate Agriculture Committees As Nonvoting Members; To Change The Nomenclature Of The Board To The Beaver And Wild Hog Control Advisory Board; And For Related Purposes.

1260.title: Domestic violence; clarify determination of third or subsequent offenses.
1260.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Determination Of Third Or Subsequent Simple Domestic Violence Offenses; And For Related Purposes.

1261.title: Driver License Examining Bureau; privatize some or all if decided by Governor and Commissioner of Public Safety.
1261.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Governor And The Commissioner Of Public Safety To Privatize Some Or All Of The Functions Of The Driver License Examining Bureau; And For Related Purposes.

1262.title: Manslaughter; revise penalty for.
1262.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Penalty For The Crime Of Manslaughter; And For Related Purposes.

1263.title: Habitual offender law; revise.
1263.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Certain Provisions Of The Habitual Offender Law; And For Related Purposes.

1264.title: State agencies and departments; require to file report with DFA of all transactions for conveyances of real property.
1264.description: An Act To Require Each Agency, Department, Community Or Junior College And Public Institution Of Higher Learning Of The State Of Mississippi To File A Report Of Transactions For All Conveyances Of Real Property, Whether Purchased, Sold, Leased, Donated Or Acquired As A Gift Or Through The Process Of Eminent Domain, To The Department Of Finance And Administration Bureau Of Buildings, Grounds And Real Property On A Basis Determined By The Department Of Finance And Administration For The Filing Of Such Reports; And For Related Purposes.

1265.title: Energy; modify and update energy code under which DFA designs and constructs projects.
1265.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-11-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Each Major Facility Project To Be Designed And Constructed To Meet Or Exceed Certain Energy Standards Of The American Society Of Heating, Refrigerating And Air-conditioning Engineers (ashrae) Or Any More Stringent Code Adopted By The Department Of Finance And Administration, Bureau Of Building, Grounds And Real Property Management; And For Related Purposes.

1266.title: Municipal Law Enforcement Employment Procedures Act; create.
1266.description: An Act To Create The "municipal Law Enforcement Employment Procedures Act"; To Require Municipalities To Provide A Pre-disciplinary Hearing For Any Law Enforcement Officer Who May Be Suspended Or Terminated; To Provide The Minimum Requirements For The Hearing; To Specify The Information That Is Required To Be In The Notice Of Hearing To The Officer; To Provide That The Officer May Attend The Hearing, May Be Represented By Counsel, May Present Evidence On His Own Behalf And Question Witnesses; To Provide That The Evidentiary Phase Of The Hearing May Be Held In Executive Session; To Provide That Final Adjudication Shall Be Held In Open Meeting; To Exempt Municipalities That Have A Civil Service Commission Or Due Process Policy From The Requirements Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1267.title: Optimal Teen Health Act; create.
1267.description: An Act To Create New Section 37-13-175, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The "optimal Teen Health Act"; To Create New Section 37-13-177, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide The Definition To Certain Terms Used Herein; To Create New Section 37-13-179, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Sexual Risk Avoidance Education Shall Be The State Standard For Sex-related Education Offered In Public Schools; To Prescribe The Standards To Be Used To Ensure That Sex-related Education Offered In Public Schools Promotes The Optimal Health Of Students Which Is Age And Grade Appropriate; To Require Local School Boards To Offer Sexual Risk Avoidance As A Component Of The Districts Curriculum Beginning No Earlier Than Grade 6; To Prohibit The Use Of Certain Materials And The Endorsement Of Certain Sexual Activities In The Curriculum; To Create New Section 37-13-181, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Each School Offering Instruction On Human Sexuality To Provide One Week's Written Notice Of Any Presentation Of Information; To Require That Schools Receive Written Permission From The Parents Of A Child Before The Child Is Allowed To Attend Such Instruction Or Presentation; To Prescribe What Information Shall Be Included In The Notice Provided To Parents; To Amend Sections 41-79-5, 41-79-51, 41-79-53 And 41-79-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Preceding Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1268.title: Hwy., 2-lane; create rebuttable presumption of fault for certain accidents involving vehicle attempting to overtake and pass another vehicle.
1268.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-609, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Rebuttable Presumption That A Driver Of A Vehicle Attempting To Overtake And Pass Another Vehicle Heading In The Same Direction On A Two-lane Highway That Is Turning Left That Results In An Accident Is The Fault Of The Driver Of The Vehicle Attempting To Overtake And Pass The Turning Vehicle; And For Related Purposes.

1269.title: Child care facilities; require to call child's contact person if child hasn't arrived within 30 minutes of usual time.
1269.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-20-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Child Care Facilities To Call The Contact Person For A Child On The List Maintained By The Facility If The Contact Person Has Not Notified The Facility That The Child Will Be Absent Or Arriving Late At The Facility, And The Child Has Not Arrived At The Facility Within Thirty Minutes After The Usual Time For Arrival; And For Related Purposes.

1270.title: Law enforcement officers; prohibit public disclosure of personnel file.
1270.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-61-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Personnel Files Of Law Enforcement Officers Shall Be Exempt From Public Records Disclosure; And For Related Purposes.

1271.title: Mississippi Eminent Scholars Fund; expand qualifications that can qualify for grant from.
1271.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-106-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Qualification Criteria For The Mississippi Eminent Scholars Grant To Provide Eligibility For Students Earning The International Baccalaureate Diploma Or The Advanced International Certificate Of Education Diploma, Students Completing The Curriculum For Those Diplomas, And Students Earning At Least Nine Credit Hours In Certain International Baccalaureate Diploma Programme Or College Board Advanced Placement Courses; And For Related Purposes.

1272.title: Contractor's tax; increase rate, increase contract amount needed to be eligible for and include certain personal property under.
1272.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Tax Imposed Upon Persons Engaging In The Business Of Contracting To 4-1/2% Of The Total Contract Price Or Compensation Received; To Increase From $10,000.00 To $100,000.00 The Compensation That Must Be Received In Order For This Tax To Apply; To Provide That Free-standing Furniture, Appliances And Other Similar Tangible Personal Property That Remain With The Structure Being Erected Or Repaired Shall Be Considered Component Parts Of The Structure If The Total Contract Price Or Compensation Received For The Project Exceeds $100,000.00, Exclusive Of The Free-standing Property If The Contract Price Includes Charges For The Free-standing Property; And For Related Purposes.

1273.title: Distinctive license tag; authorize issuance to supporters of the Newton County School System.
1273.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Newton County School System; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

1274.title: Public lands; prohibit nonresident aliens and illegal non-U.S. citizens from acquiring.
1274.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-1-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Nonresident Aliens And Noncitizens Illegally In The United States From Acquiring Public Lands; And For Related Purposes.

1276.title: Motor vehicle accident; repeal laws requiring security deposit after.
1276.description: An Act To Repeal Sections 63-15-11 Through 63-15-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Require The Deposit Of Security For Damages Resulting From A Motor Vehicle Accident And Provide For The Suspension Of Licenses And Registrations Upon The Failure To Deposit The Security; And For Related Purposes.

1277.title: Careless driving; create rebuttable presumption that texting while driving is.
1277.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-1213, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Rebuttable Presumption That Using A Wireless Communication Device To Send Or Receive A Written Message While Operating A Moving Motor Vehicle Is Careless Driving; And For Related Purposes.

1278.title: County surveyors; revise how such are compensated for services.
1278.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-7-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Compensation Of The County Surveyor Shall Be Determined By The Board Of Supervisors Of The County Employing Such Surveyor; To Provide That The Manner Of Making Such Compensation Shall Be Spread Upon The Minutes Of The Board; And For Related Purposes.

1279.title: Sixteenth section lands; clarify provisions relating to validity of leases and fair market rental value.
1279.description: An Act To Clarify That A Lease Of Sixteenth Section Lands That Is Duly Executed By The School Board Of The Local School District Is Presumed To Be Valid; To Clarify That The Approval Of The Secretary Of State Is Not Necessary Before The School Board May Enter Into Any Such Lease; To Provide That The Secretary Of State May Object To The Validity Of Such A Lease By Filing An Action In The Appropriate Chancery Court And Demonstrating That The Lease Is Unconscionable Or Otherwise Not Valid; To Provide That School Board Members Acting In Good Faith Are Immune From Individual Liability Associated With Entering Into The Lease; To Grant Certain Former Leaseholders Of Sixteenth Section Land Previously Classified As Farm Residential Before Being Arbitrarily Reappraised And Reclassified As Forest Land The Option Of Again Leasing The Land As Farm Residential Land; To Amend Section 29-3-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Preceding Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 29-3-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Preceding Provisions And To Authorize The Transfer Of Farm Residential Leasehold Interests; To Bring Forward Section 29-3-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1280.title: Energy efficiency standards; revise for commercial buildings.
1280.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-39-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Energy Efficiency Standards For Commercial Buildings; To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority Shall Not Have Enforcement Authority Over This Section Of Law; And For Related Purposes.

1281.title: Flood and drainage control districts; delete requirement for election before issuance of bonds by.
1281.description: An Act To Amend Section 51-35-325, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Provisions Of Law Providing For A Mandatory Election Before The Issuance Of Bonds By A Flood And Drainage Control District; To Provide That A Flood And Drainage Control District Proposing To Issue Bonds Must Publish Notice Of Its Intent To Issue Bonds And That An Election On The Question Of The Issuance Of The Bonds Will Be Held If The Lesser Of Twenty Percent Or Fifteen Hundred Of The Qualified Electors Living Or Owning Property In The District Protest Against The Issuance Of Such Bonds; And For Related Purposes.

1282.title: Liens; provide for the enforceability of mechanic's and materialmen's liens.
1282.description: An Act To Provide For The Enforceability Of Mechanic's And Materialmen's Liens; To Require The Filing Of A Statement Regarding A Lien; To Require Written Notice To Owners That A Lien May Be Instituted If Payment Is Not Made; To Specify Persons Deemed Not To Be An Original Contractor; To Require A Pre-lien Notice And Provide For The Contents Of Such Notice; To Amend Sections 85-7-131, 85-7-133 And 85-7-135, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

1283.title: Youth sports concussions and head injuries; require athletic activity organizations to adopt policy relating to.
1283.description: An Act To Require The Governing Body Of Youth Athletic Activities To Adopt A Policy Concerning Sports Concussions And Head Injuries; To Define Certain Terms; To Require The Policy And Concussion Training Materials To Be Provided To Coaches And Officials; To Require The Adoption Of A Protocol That Must Be Satisfied In Order For A Youth Athlete To Return To Play After Sustaining A Concussion Or Head Injury; And For Related Purposes.

1284.title: Local and private taxes; authorize a compensation to taxpayers for collecting and filing returns for.
1284.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Compensation To Taxpayers For Collecting Taxes Imposed Under Local And Private Laws Of This State And Filing Necessary Returns With The Department Of Revenue; To Provide For The Amount Of Such Compensation; And For Related Purposes.

1285.title: Open preferential primaries; authorize.
1285.description: An Act To Abolish Partisan Primaries; To Provide The Time For Holding General And Preferential Elections; To Provide That When Only One Person Has Qualified As A Candidate For An Office, Such Person's Name Shall Be Placed On The General Election Ballot; To Provide That A Preferential Election Shall Be Held Three Weeks Before The General Election And The Candidate Who Receives A Majority Of The Votes Cast For Such Office Shall Have His Name And His Name Only Placed On The General Election Ballot; To Provide That When No Candidate Receives A Majority Of The Votes Cast In The Preferential Election For An Office, That The Two Candidates Who Receive The Highest Number Of Votes In The Preferential Election Shall Have Their Names Placed On The General Election Ballot As Candidates For Such Office; To Provide The Procedure To Follow In Case Of Ties; To Provide The Manner For Qualifying As A Candidate For Public Office; To Provide For The Printing Of Necessary Ballots; To Amend Sections 21-7-7, 21-8-7, 21-15-1, 23-15-21, 23-15-31, 23-15-129, 23-15-153, 23-15-173, 23-15-197, 23-15-313, 23-15-367, 23-15-375, 23-15-403, 23-15-411, 23-15-463, 23-15-465, 23-15-507, 23-15-511, 23-15-559, 23-15-561, 23-15-573, 23-15-593, 23-15-595, 23-15-601, 23-15-605, 23-15-673, 23-15-713, 23-15-755, 23-15-771, 23-15-801, 23-15-807, 23-15-811, 23-15-833, 23-15-859, 23-15-873, 23-15-881, 23-15-885, 23-15-891, 23-15-899, 23-15-911, 23-15-973, 23-15-1065, 23-15-1085 And 23-15-1087, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Repeal Section 23-15-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Preparation, Use And Revision Of Primary Election Pollbooks; To Repeal Section 23-15-171, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Dates Of Municipal Primary Elections; To Repeal Section 23-15-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Date Of State, District And County Primary Elections; To Repeal Sections 23-15-263, 23-15-265, 23-15-267, 23-15-291 Through 23-15-311, 23-15-317, 23-15-319, 23-15-331, 23-15-333 And 23-15-335, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Duties Of The State Executive Committee And County Executive Committees In Primary Elections, Provide For The Qualification Of Candidates For Party Primary Elections, And Provide For The Conduct Of Party Primary Elections; To Repeal Sections 23-15-359, 23-15-361 And 23-15-363, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Contents Of General Election Ballots; To Repeal Sections 23-15-597 And 23-15-599, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Canvass Of Returns And Announcement Of Vote By The County Executive Committees In Primary Elections And Require The State Executive Committee To Transmit To The Secretary Of State A Tabulated Statement Of The Party Vote For Certain Offices; To Repeal Section 23-15-841, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Primary Elections For Nomination Of Candidates To Fill Vacancies In County And County District Offices; To Repeal Sections 23-15-921 Through 23-15-941, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Procedures For Contests Of Primary Elections; To Repeal Section 23-15-1031, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Date Of Primary Elections For Congressmen And United States Senators; To Repeal Section 23-15-1063, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits Unregistered Political Parties From Conducting Primary Elections; To Repeal Section 23-15-1083, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Requires That Certain Congressional Primaries Be Held On The Same Day As The Presidential Preference Primary; And For Related Purposes.

1286.title: Crisis Intervention Teams; revise various provisions of laws providing for.
1286.description: An Act To Amend Sections 41-21-61, 41-21-67, 41-21-131, 41-21-133, 41-21-135, 41-21-137, 41-21-139, 41-21-141 And 41-21-143, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Various Provisions Of The Laws Providing For Crisis Intervention Teams; And For Related Purposes.

1287.title: Tobacco use and smoking; clarify authority of public and private employers to ask applicants for employment about.
1287.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-7-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Any Public Or Private Employer Is Authorized To Ask An Applicant For Employment Whether Such Person Smokes Or Uses Tobacco Products; And For Related Purposes.

1288.title: Cosmetology licensure law; revise various provisions of.
1288.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-7-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify And Revise Definitions Of Several Terms Used In The Cosmetology Laws; To Amend Section 73-7-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Update The Association Name Which Elects Delegates To The Mississippi Cosmetology Council; To Amend Section 73-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board Of Cosmetology To Issue A Temporary Permit To Any Student Who Has Completed Prescribed Hours In A Licensed School And Paid The Required Fee; To Require Passport Photographs Of The Applicant With The Application For Examination And License; And To Require Biennial Payment Of Fees For Processing An Inactive License To Amend Section 73-7-14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Master Manicurist And Esthetician Licenses; To Amend Section 73-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Requirements For A Cosmetology Instructor's License; To Amend Section 73-7-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Payment Of Fees For School License Biennially; To Remove Certain Exemptions For Hiring And Training Faculty At Nationally Accredited School; To Clarify The Admission Requirements That Schools Must Follow On Aptitude Tests In Admitting Students; And To Remove Certain Requirements Of Evidence Of National Accreditation For Private Business And Vocational Schools; To Amend Section 73-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A New Application For A Salon License Expired For Over One Year; To Amend Section 73-7-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Adoption Of Regulation On Use Of Electric Nail Files For Filing False Or Natural Nails; To Amend Section 73-7-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Provisions For Licensure By Reciprocity; To Amend Section 73-7-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Filing Of An Appeal Of Adverse Ruling Or Order Or Decision Of The Board Of Cosmetology To The Chancery Court Of The First Judicial District Of Hinds County; And To Increase The Amount Of Fines For Violations; To Amend Section 73-7-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Board Of Cosmetology To Have Full Authority To Establish And Assess Fees; To Amend Section 73-7-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of Fines For Violations; To Establish Any Court Of Competent Jurisdiction In Hinds County As Venue For Filing Actions In Violation Of Cosmetology Laws; And Establish Chancery Court Of First Judicial District Of Hinds County As Venue For Applying For Orders Enjoining Violations Or Enforcing Compliance With Provisions Of Cosmetology Laws; To Repeal Sections 73-5-51 Mississippi Code Of 1972, Through 73-7-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Relating To Wig Specialists And Wig Salons; To Repeal Section 73-7-63, Relating To The Automatic Repealor Of Sections Which Create The State Board Of Cosmetology And Prescribe Its Duties And Powers; To Amend Sections 73-7-9, 73-7-12, 73-7-13, 73-7-19, 73-7-35 And 73-7-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1289.title: U.S. Highway 61; designate segment in Warren County as "The Purple Heart Trail."
1289.description: An Act To Designate U.s. Highway 61 Located In Warren County As "the Purple Heart Trail"; And For Related Purposes.

1290.title: Bonds; increase amount authorized to be issued for the Rural Fire Truck Fund.
1290.description: An Act To Amend Sections 136 Through 151, Chapter 1, Laws Of 2004 Third Extraordinary Session, As Last Amended By Section 14, Chapter 480, Laws Of 2011, To Increase The Amount Of Bonds That May Be Issued For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Rural Fire Truck Fund; To Extend The Authority To Issue Such Bonds Until July 1, 2015; And For Related Purposes.

1291.title: Abortion; require sonogram on women and verbal explanation of sonogram results before performing of.
