1892.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 42, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Decrease The Minimum Age To Be A Member Of The Mississippi State Senate From 25 To 18 Years Of Age; And For Related Purposes.

1893.title: Constitution; amend to provide that minimum age to serve in Mississippi House of Representatives is 18 years.
1893.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 41, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Decrease The Minimum Age To Be A Member Of The Mississippi House Of Representatives From 21 Years To 18 Years Of Age; And For Related Purposes.

1894.title: Constitution; dedicate certain percentage of General Fund to repair and renovation of state-owned properties.
1894.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 By Adding A New Section That Provides For The Necessary Maintenance And Capital Improvement Of State-owned Properties; To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury, Into Which Shall Be Deposited One Percent Of The Unencumbered Cash Balance In The General Fund At The Close Of Each Fiscal Year, Beginning On July 1, 2016; To Provide That Monies In The Special Fund Can Only Be Used For Capital Improvements And Repair And Renovation Of State-owned Properties; And For Related Purposes.

1895.title: Sergeant Jeremy D. Butler; commend and congratulate upon being named Marine of the Year.
1895.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Sergeant Jeremy D. Butler Upon Being Honored As 2nd Marine Division's Marine Of The Year At The Ninth Annual Marine Corps Association And Foundation Ground Awards Dinner.

1896.title: William Garrett; commend upon receiving French Legion of Honor Medal.
1896.description: A Concurrent Resolution Paying Tribute To World War Ii Combat Veteran, William Garrett, Of Winona, Mississippi, Upon His Receipt Of The French Legion Of Honor Medal.

1897.title: Joint Rules; amend to limit number of bill introductions.
1897.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Amend The Joint Rules Of The House Of Representatives And The Senate By Creating A New Rule 9b To Limit The Total Number Of Bills And Resolutions That A Legislator May Request For Drafting And Introduce During A Regular Legislative Session.

1899.title: Constitution; establish legal holidays of African American Day and of Women's Day.
1899.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Establish Two Legal Holidays In The Constitution, In Addition To Those Which May Be Provided By The Legislature In General Law; To Designate The Last Day Of February As "african American Day" And August 26 As "women's Day"; And For Related Purposes.

1900.title: Constitution; allow citizen to request drafting of bill and create new criminal offenses regarding conduct of law enforcement and judicial officers.
1900.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend Section 56 Of The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 To Allow A Qualified Elector With Certain Educational Qualifications To Request That A Proposed Bill Be Drafted By The Applicable Legal Offices Of The State Senate And The House Of Representatives; To Add A New Section To Create New Criminal Offenses Related To The Conduct Of A Law Enforcement Officer, Attorney, District Attorney, Prosecuting Attorney Or Judge; And For Related Purposes.

1901.title: Slavery; issue apology for state's role in.
1901.description: A Concurrent Resolution Apologizing For The Wrongs Of Slavery, And Expressing Regret For Mississippi's Role In Slavery, And Urging Reconciliation.

1902.title: State appointments, certain; urge to reflect more of the demographics and diversity of the state.
1902.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging That State Appointments For Agency Directors, Commissioners And Boards Be More Reflective Of The Demographics And Diversity Of The State Of Mississippi.

1903.title: State of poverty in Mississippi; acknowledge need for improved economic viability and increased awareness.
1903.description: A Concurrent Resolution Acknowledging The State Of Poverty In The State Of Mississippi, Recognizing The State's 20 Poorest Counties And Their Impact On The Overall Status Of Our State, And Encouraging The Improvement Of Their Economic Viability Through Increased Awareness And Creation Of Opportunity By Emphasizing The Importance Of The Inter-relationship With All 82 Counties As It Relates To The Social And Economic Rankings In The State Of Mississippi.

1904.title: Constitution; amend to provide that the right to life is a fundamental right and "person" applies to all humans from conception.
1904.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Article 3 Of The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, By Creating A New Section 32a To Provide That The Right To Life Is The Paramount And Most Fundamental Right Of A Person; To Provide That The Word "person" Applies To All Human Beings From Conception To Natural Death, With A Certain Exception; To Specify Certain Activities That Are Not Affected Or Prohibited By This Section, Including Contraception Or Birth Control Not Killing A Person, In Vitro Fertilization Or Other Methods Of Reproduction, Medical Treatment Intended To Preserve Life, Or Miscarriage; And For Related Purposes.

1905.title: Constitution; amend to provide for gubernatorial appointment of the State Superintendent of Public Education.
1905.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 202, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide For The Gubernatorial Appointment Of The State Superintendent Of Public Education Beginning With The Election Of The Governor At The General Election In 2015.

1906.title: Constitution; amend to elect Governor by majority of popular vote, with no electoral vote requirement.
1906.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 By Amending Sections 140 And 142 And Repealing Section 141 To Provide That The Person Receiving The Majority Of Votes For The Office Of Governor At The General Election Shall Be Declared Elected; To Provide That If No Person Receives A Majority Of The Votes, Then A Runoff Election Shall Be Held Between The Two Persons Receiving The Highest Number Of Votes; To Abolish The Requirement That The Governor Be Elected By Vote Of The House Of Representatives If No Person Receives Both A Majority Of The Popular Vote And A Majority Of The Electoral Votes; And For Related Purposes.

1907.title: Constitution; amend to authorize metropolitan government.
1907.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Require The Legislature To Enact General Law And To Permit The Legislature To Enact Local And Private Law Prescribing The Manner And Procedure By Which Counties And Cities May Merge And Consolidate To Form A Metropolitan Government; And For Related Purposes.

1908.title: Constitution; amend to require local and private bill proposing tax to provide for direct referendum on question of imposing tax.
1908.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend Section 89, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That If A Local And Private Bill Proposes To Impose, Increase Or Extend A Tax Of Any Kind Within A Specific Governmental Entity, Locality Or Area, Then The Bill Shall Provide For A Direct Referendum To Be Held On The Question Of Imposing, Increasing Or Extending The Tax; To Provide That The Referendum Shall Be Held At The Same Time As The Next Regularly Scheduled Election In The Area.

1909.title: Bianca Knight; commend upon winning Olympic Gold Medal in 2012 London Games.
1909.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Bianca Knight Upon Winning The Gold Medal In The Women's 4x100-meter Relay At The 2012 Olympic Summer Games In London, England.

1910.title: Ocean Springs Girls Cross County Team; commend and congratulate upon winning 2012 State Championship.
1910.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Ocean Springs High School Girls Cross Country Team And Coach Tim Sayers On Winning The 2012 Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 6a State Championship.

1911.title: Ocean Springs Boys Cross Country Team; commend and congratulate upon winning 2012 State Championship.
1911.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Ocean Springs High School Boys Cross Country Team And Coach Tim Sayers On Winning The 2012 Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 6a State Championship.

1912.title: Congress; urge to amend U.S. Constitution to prohibit corporations from having certain rights.
1912.description: A Concurrent Resolution Requesting The Congress Of The United States To Call A Convention For The Sole Purpose Of Proposing An Amendment To The Constitution Of The United States To Abolish The Concept Of Corporate Personhood And Urging The Legislative Bodies Of The Several States To Apply To The Congress To Call Such A Convention.

1913.title: Constitution; amend to provide for a state university system state board of governors and local board of trustees.
1913.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 213a, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Clarify That The Legislature Shall Make Adequate Provision By Law For The Establishment, Maintenance And Operation Of The Eight Public Universities In The State Of Mississippi; To Provide For A State University System Comprised Of The Eight Public Universities In The State Of Mississippi; To Establish A System Of Governance For The State University System Of Mississippi; To Provide For A Board Of Governors For The Management Of The State University System Comprised Of The Membership Of The Present Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning; To Prescribe The General Responsibilities Of The Board Of Governors Of The State University System; To Provide For Local Boards Of Trustees For The Administration Of Each University In The State University System; To Prescribe The General Responsibilities Of The Local Boards Of Trustees; And For Related Purposes.

1914.title: South Panola Tigers Football Team; commend and congratulate upon winning 2012 MHSAA Class 6A State Championship.
1914.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The South Panola High School Tigers Football Team For Their Outstanding 2012 Season And For Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 6a State Championship.

1915.title: Chandler Llana; commend upon being named 2012 Mississippi Miss Hospitality.
1915.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Ms. Chandler Llana Upon Being Crowned 2012 Mississippi Miss Hospitality.

1916.title: Ripley High School Band; commend upon winning Class 3A MHSAA State Championship.
1916.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Ripley High School Tigers Marching Band Under The Direction Of Sam Cunningham Upon Winning The Class 3a Mississippi High School Activities Association State Marching Band Championship.

1917.title: Brittany Reese; commend upon winning gold medal in Olympic long jump.
1917.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Brittney Reese Upon Winning The Gold Medal In Women's Long Jump At The 2012 Olympic Summer Games In London, England.

1918.title: Constitution; revise voter initiative procedure to conform signature requirements to number of existing congressional districts.
1918.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 273, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, Which Relates To The Power Of The People To Enact Constitutional Amendments By Initiative, To Conform The Maximum Percentage Of The Number Of Signatures Of Qualified Electors Allowed From Any Single Congressional District To The Percentage That The District Represents In Relation To The Total Number Of Congressional Districts; And For Related Purposes.

1919.title: Joint Session; call to hear State of the State address of Governor Phil Bryant.
1919.description: A Concurrent Resolution Providing For A Joint Session Of The Mississippi Legislature To Hear The State Of The State Address Of Governor Phil Bryant.

1921.title: Constitution; corporation shall not have any right or privilege not granted to the people or an individual person.
1921.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Sections 32, 181, 182 And 199, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That A Corporation Shall Not Have Any Right Or Privilege Granted To The People Or To An Individual Person; To Provide That A Corporation Shall Not Receive A Property Or Income Tax Credit, Deduction Or Exemption That Is Not Allowed To An Individual Person; And For Related Purposes.

1922.title: Constitution; automatically restore suffrage to persons convicted of certain offenses upon completing sentence & other conditions.
1922.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Sections 253 And 241, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That A Person Disqualified As An Elector By Reason Of Conviction Of Certain Felony Offenses Shall Have His Right To Vote Restored Automatically Upon Completion Of His Sentence, Probation, Parole And Any Other Conditions As The Legislature, May Prescribe By General Law; And For Related Purposes.

1923.title: Lanier High School National Championship Boys Basketball Team (1964-65); commend and congratulate upon induction into MS Sports Hall of Fame.
1923.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 1964-1965 Lanier High School National Championship Boys Basketball Team Upon Their Induction Into The Mississippi Sports Hall Of Fame.

1924.title: Joint Rules; amend to require election in any local and private bill imposing, extending or increasing a tax.
1924.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Amend Joint Rule 38 Of The Senate And The House To Require That The Provisions Of Any Local And Private Bill Which Authorize The Imposition Or Extension Of Any Tax Or Any Increase In Tax Shall Not Be Made Effective Except After Approval By A Majority Of The Qualified Electors Voting In An Election Held For Such Purpose.

1925.title: Constitution; amend to provide that all human beings at every stage of development shall enjoy equal rights as persons.
1925.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Article 14 Of The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, By Creating A New Section 265a To Provide That All Human Beings At Every Stage Of Development Are Unique, Created In The Image Of God, And Shall Enjoy Equal Rights Under The Law; And For Related Purposes.

1926.title: Law Enforcement Appreciation Day; designate first Monday of April as.
1926.description: A Concurrent Resolution Hereinafter Designating The First Monday Of April As Law Enforcement Appreciation Day In The State Of Mississippi.

1927.title: Mahmoud Abul-Rauf; commend upon retirement after exceptional basketball career.
1927.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Gulfport, Mississippi, Native Mr. Mahmoud Abdul-rauf Upon His Retirement After An Exceptional Career As A Professional Basketball Player.

1928.title: State sovereignty; affirming sovereignty of the State of Mississippi under the 10th Amendment of U.S. Constitution.
1928.description: A Concurrent Resolution Affirming The Sovereignty Of The People Of The State Of Mississippi Under The Tenth Amendment To The Constitution Of The United States Over All Powers Not Otherwise Delegated To The Federal Government By The Constitution Of The United States.

1929.title: Senator Alice Harden; commend life and legacy of public service upon her passing.
1929.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life And Legacy Of Public Service Of The Honorable Senator Alice Rae Varnado Harden, And Extending Deepest Sympathy To Her Family And Friends Upon Her Passing.

1930.title: Constitution; amend to require Governor to give Legislature advance notice of extraordinary session.
1930.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 121, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Require A Proclamation Which Calls The Legislature Into Extraordinary Session To Be Issued At Least Five Calendar Days Before The Convening Of The Legislature In Extraordinary Session; And For Related Purposes.

1931.title: Constitution; amend to set forth composition of PERS board of trustees.
1931.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing A New Section 272b, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Set Forth The Composition Of The Board Of Trustees Of The Public Employees' Retirement System; And For Related Purposes.

1932.title: Constitution; amend to change day of general election for state and county officers from Tuesday to Saturday.
1932.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Section 102, Section 140 And Section 252, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Change The Day Of The General Election For State And County Elected Officers From The First Tuesday After The First Monday In November To The First Saturday After The First Monday In November, Beginning In 2015.

1933.title: Constitution; expedite date of election submitting to people the amendment adopted by Legislature to create right to hunt.
1933.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Amend Chapter 2024, Laws Of 2012, Which Proposes To Submit To The Qualified Electors Of The State, An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 That Would Add A New Section 12a To The Constitution To Establish The Right To Hunt, Fish And Harvest Wildlife; To Change, From November 2014 To November 2013, The Date Of The Submission To The Qualified Electors Of The State Of The Proposed Amendment; To Clarify That The Proposed Right To Hunt, Fish And Harvest Wildlife Does Not Modify Or Diminish The Right Of Individual Mississippi Citizens To Keep And Bear Arms; And For Related Purposes.

1934.title: United States Constitution; urge Congress to call convention to amend regarding prayer in schools.
1934.description: A Concurrent Resolution Requesting The Congress Of The United States To Call A Convention For The Sole Purpose Of Proposing An Amendment To The Constitution Of The United States Relating To Prayer In Public Schools And Urging And Requesting The Legislative Bodies Of The Several States To Apply To The Congress To Call Such A Convention.

1935.title: Congress; urge to amend federal law to require removal of negative information from credit report after four years.
1935.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging Congress To Amend The Federal Fair Credit Reporting Act To Require Consumer Credit Reporting Agencies To Remove Accurate But Negative Information From A Person's Credit Report After Four Years.

1936.title: Constitution; amend to require actual cause or physical evidence before a search warrant is issued.
1936.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 23, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That A Search Warrant Shall Only Be Issued For Actual Cause Or Physical Evidence Instead Of Probable Cause; And For Related Purposes.

1937.title: Constitution; provide that defense of double jeopardy shall not be an available defense to person accused of killing an unarmed person.
1937.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 22, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That The Defense Of Double Jeopardy, Which Protects A Person Against A Second Prosecution For The Same Offense After Acquittal Or Conviction And Against Multiple Punishments For The Same Offense, Shall Not Be An Available Defense To Any Person Who Is Accused Of Killing An Unarmed Person; And For Related Purposes.

1939.title: U.S. Constitution; urge Congress to call convention to amend 5th Amendment relative to double jeopardy.
1939.description: A Concurrent Resolution Requesting The Congress Of The United States To Call A Convention For The Sole Purpose Of Proposing An Amendment To The Constitution Of The United States Relating To The Double Jeopardy Clause Of The Fifth Amendment And Requesting The Legislative Bodies Of The Several States To Apply To The Congress To Call Such A Convention.

1940.title: Constitution; amend to lower vote requirement from 3/5 to majority for passage of a bill that lowers a tax.
1940.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 70, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That The Vote Requirement For The Passage Of A Bill That Reduces A Tax Is Only A Majority Vote Of Each House Of The Legislature; And For Related Purposes.

1941.title: Representative William E. "Billy" Bowles; commend life and legacy of public service upon his passing.
1941.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Public Service Of The Former Representative, Honorable William Eugene "billy" Bowles, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family, Colleagues And Friends Upon His Passing.

1942.title: Constitution; amend to change day of November election for statewide officers from Tuesday to Saturday.
1942.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Section 102, Section 140 And Section 252, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Change The Day On Which The Election Of Statewide Officers Occurs From The First Tuesday After The First Monday In November To The First Saturday After The First Monday In November, Beginning In 2015.

1943.title: State of Mississippi; urge to take critical and fundamental actions to improve the state's economic and social rankings.
1943.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing Economic And Social Rankings And Encouraging Mississippi Agencies, And Public And Private Entities To Take Critical And Fundamental Actions To Improve Mississippi's Economic And Social Rankings.

1944.title: Ocean Springs High School Dance Team; commend on winning Large Varsity Division State Championship in Jazz Category.
1944.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Ocean Springs High School Dance Team And Coach Kim Perry For Winning The 2012-2013 Large Varsity Division State Dance Championship In Both The Pom Category And Jazz Category.

1945.title: Ocean Springs High School Cheerleading Team; commend on winning Large Varsity Division State Championship.
1945.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Ocean Springs High School Greyhounds Cheerleading Team And Coach Kelly Pilger For Winning The 2012-2013 Mississippi High School Activities Association Large Varsity Division State Cheerleading Championship.

1946.title: Bianca Knight; commend upon winning Olympic Gold Medal.
1946.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Bianca Knight Upon Winning The Gold Medal In The Women's 4x100-meter Relay At The 2012 Olympic Summer Games In London, England.

1948.title: Firefighters Appreciation Day; designate first Monday in February as.
1948.description: A Concurrent Resolution Hereinafter Designating The First Monday Of February As Firefighter Appreciation Day In The State Of Mississippi.

1950.title: Representative Joe C. Gardner; commend life and legacy of public service upon his passing.
1950.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Public Service Of The Honorable Reverend Dr. Joe C. Gardner, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family, Colleagues And Friends Upon His Passing.

1951.title: Hazlehurst High School Indians Football Team; commend upon winning Class 3A State Championship.
1951.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The

1952.title: Fredda Sanderson McCune; commend career and congratulate upon occasion of her retirement.
1952.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Exceptional And Dedicated Career Of Mrs. Fredda Sanderson Mccune And Congratulating Her Upon The Occasion Of Her Retirement From The Iuka Library After 34 Years Of Distinguished Service.

1953.title: Craig Noone; commemorate life and legacy of.
1953.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commemorating The Life And Legacy Of Jackson Restaurateur Craig Ashton Noone.

1954.title: Marie Elizabeth Wicks; commend upon being crowned Miss Mississippi USA 2012.
1954.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Marie Elizabeth Wicks Of Ocean Springs, Mississippi, Upon Being Crowned Miss Mississippi Usa 2012.

1955.title: Mrs. Sharon Walker; commend exemplary service to the Ocean Springs School Board.
1955.description: A Concurrent Resolution Acknowledging And Commending The Exceptionally Diligent Service Mrs. Sharon Walker Rendered To The Ocean Springs School District Board Of Trustees.

1956.title: Civil Air Patrol members; commend the lives of the three patrolmen who passed on November 13, 2012.
1956.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Lives Of Colonel John E. Tilton, Jr., Lieutenant Colonel Anthony D. Williams And Captain William C. Young, Jr., Members Of The Civil Air Patrol, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To Their Families And Friends Upon Their Passing.

1957.title: Pfc. Patricia Horne; commend valiant military service upon her passing in furtherance of Operation Enduring Freedom.
1957.description: A Concurrent Resolution Remembering The Gallant Service And Mourning The Loss Of United States Army Private First Class Patricia L. Horne Of Greenwood, Mississippi, Who Died In The Line Of Duty On August 24, 2012, In Bagram, Afghanistan, And Extend Deepest Sympathy To Her Family And Friends Upon Her Passing.

1958.title: Dr. Grant A. Dungee, III; commend life and legacy upon his passing.
1958.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Dr. Grant Alan Dungee, Iii, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family, Colleagues And Friends Upon His Passing.

1959.title: Columbia Academy; commend and congratulate upon winning 2010, 2011, and 2012 MAIS State Championships in Boys Cross Country.
1959.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Columbia Academy Boys Cross Country Team And Head Coach Duane Powell And Assistant Coach Dan Fails On Winning The 2010, 2011 And 2012 Mississippi Association Of Independent Schools State Championships.

1960.title: Reverend Nathaniel V. Booker; commend life, heritage and legacy upon his passing.
1960.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life, Legacy And Heritage Of Reverend Nathaniel Vinson Booker, And Extending Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1961.title: Suspend deadlines for introduction; Medicaid; extend repealers on various provisions in Medicaid program.
1961.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Amend Sections 43-13-107 And 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Automatic Repealer On The Statutes Which Establish The Division Of Medicaid And Provide Health Care Services Covered Under The Medicaid Program; To Delete The Freeze On Nursing Facility Reimbursement Rates; To Bring Forward Section 43-13-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972; To Amend Section 43-13-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Automatic Repealer On The Transportation Program For Recipients Receiving Necessary Dialysis Services; To Amend Section 43-13-145, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealers On The Annual Assessment On Licensed Hospitals In Mississippi To Provide Funding For The Medicaid Program, On Administrative Provisions Relating To The Hospital Assessment, And On The Payment Of Additional Annual Medicare Upper Payment Limits And Disproportionate Share Hospital Payments To Mississippi Hospitals That Participate In The Medicaid Program; And For Related Purposes."

1963.title: Pastor Saeed Abedini; commend dedication of.
1963.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Dedication Of Pastor Saeed Abedini As He Endures Unjustified Imprisonment In Iran For Following His Calling As A Minister Of The Gospel.

1964.title: Dallas Stricker; commend and congratulate upon being named 2012 State Games Male Athlete of the Year.
1964.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Dallas Stricker Upon Being Named The 2012 State Games Of Missisippi At&t Male Athlete Of The Year.

1965.title: Christie Stricker; commend and congratulate upon being name 2012 State Games Female Athlete of the Year.
1965.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Christie Stricker On Being Selected As The 2012 State Games Of Mississippi At&t Female Athlete Of The Year.

1966.title: Coach Sank Powe, Jr.; commend life and legacy of.
1966.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Great Life And Legacy Of Coach Sank Powe, Jr., And Honoring His Legacy Of Leadership, Education And Mentorship And Expressing Our Deepest Sympathy Upon His Passing.

1967.title: Dr. Matthew Holden; recognize the academic achievements and public service of.
1967.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Academic Achievements And Public Service Of Dr. Matthew Holden, Academician.

1968.title: James Adair "Jimmy" Pigford; commend life and legacy of Meridian's performing arts legend.
1968.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commemorating The Life And Legacy Of Meridian's Performing Arts Legend, James Adair "jimmy" Pigford, And Expressing Sympathy To His Family And Many Friends Upon His Passing.

1969.title: Pearl High School Pirate Band; commend and congratulate upon winning MHSAA/MBA 2012 Class 5A State Marching Band Championship.
1969.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Pearl High School Pirate Marching Band And Band Director Jeff Cannon For Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association/mississippi Band Association 2012 Class 5a State Marching Band Championship For The Second Consecutive Year.

1971.title: Bishop Jonathan Tate, Sr.; commend on 50 years of pastorship of Anointed Temple A.O.H. Church of God.
1971.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Ministerial Service, Leadership And Spiritual Excellence Of Bishop Jonathan Tate, Sr., On The Occasion Of His 50th Anniversary As Pastor Of Anointed Temple Apostolic Overcoming Holy Church Of God.

1972.title: Marie Elizabeth Wicks; commend and congratulate upon being crowned Miss Mississippi 2012.
1972.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Marie Elizabeth Wicks Of Ocean Springs, Mississippi, Upon Being Crowned Miss Mississippi 2012.

1974.title: Aza Brown Upton; commend upon retirement from the Leflore County School District.
1974.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Exceptional And Dedicated Career Of Mrs. Aza Brown Upton And Congratulating Her Upon The Occasion Of Her Retirement From The Leflore County School District After More Than 40 Years Of Distinguished Service.

1975.title: Suspend deadlines for introduction; Medicaid; extend various repealers and expand eligibility.
1975.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Amend Sections 43-13-107 And 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealers On The Statutes That Establish The Division Of Medicaid And Provide Health Care Services Covered Under The Medicaid Program; To Amend Section 43-13-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Medicaid Coverage For Individuals Who Are Under 65 Years Of Age, Are Not Pregnant, Are Not Entitled To Or Enrolled For Medicare Benefits And Whose Income Is Not More Than 133% Of The Federal Poverty Level, As Authorized Under The Federal Patient Protection And Affordable Care Act; To Amend Section 43-13-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On The Transportation Program For Recipients Receiving Necessary Dialysis Services; To Amend Section 43-13-145, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of The Repealers On The Annual Assessment On Licensed Hospitals In Mississippi To Provide Funding For The Medicaid Program, On Administrative Provisions Relating To The Hospital Assessment, And On The Payment Of Additional Annual Medicare Upper Payment Limits And Disproportionate Share Hospital Payments To Mississippi Hospitals That Participate In The Medicaid Program; And For Related Purposes."

1976.title: Suspend deadlines for introduction; Firearms Protection Act.
1976.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Provide An Exemption From Enforcement Of Federal Law Regarding Firearms, Accessories Or Ammunition; To Provide A Penalty For Violations Of This Act; To Amend Sections 45-9-101, 97-37-5, 97-37-7, 97-37-31, 97-37-103 And 97-37-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

1977.title: Mr. Red Bailey; commend life and legacy upon his passing.
1977.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life, Legacy And Service Of C.e. "red" Bailey, A Respected Hattiesburg Leader And Citizen, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1978.title: Dr. Rodney Bennett; welcome as 10th President of the University of Southern Mississippi.
1978.description: A Concurrent Resolution Welcoming Dr. Rodney D. Bennett To The State Of Mississippi And Congratulating Him On Being Named The Tenth President Of The University Of Southern Mississippi.

1979.title: Mississippi Phi Theta Kappa Day; recognize March 26, 2013, as.
1979.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Members Of Phi Theta Kappa's All-mississippi Academic Team On The Occasion Of "mississippi Phi Theta Kappa Day."

1980.title: Parental rights; State of Mississippi recognizes.
1980.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing Parental Rights.

1981.title: Cassandra "Cassi" Davis; commend for acting career and receiving award for Outstanding Actress in a Comedy Series in 2013.
1981.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Cassandra "cassi" Davis For Her Distinguished Acting Career And For Receiving The Naacp Image Award For Outstanding Actress In A Comedy Series For The Second Time In 2013.

1982.title: Hilton Hollis; commend upon success in the fashion industry.
1982.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Mr. Hilton Hollis Upon His Accomplishments In The Fashion Industry.

1983.title: Dr. Andy Mullins; commend on retirement after lifelong career dedicated to improving education.
1983.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Dr. Andy Mullins, Longtime Education Adviser To The State Of Mississippi, On The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1984.title: Mr. Bill McPeters; honor and celebrate the life and legacy of and express sympathy upon his passing.
1984.description: A Concurrent Resolution Honoring And Celebrating The Life And Legacy Of Mr. Bill Mcpeters And Expressing Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1985.title: Biggersville Lions Boys Basketball Team; commend for winning the Class 1A State Championship.
1985.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Biggersville High School Lions Boys Basketball Team For Winning The Class 1a State Championship.

1986.title: U.S. Constitution; urge Congress to call convention to amend for purpose of adding parental rights amendment.
1986.description: A Concurrent Resolution Requesting The Congress Of The United States To Propose An Amendment To The Constitution Of The United States Relating To Parental Rights And Urging The Legislative Bodies Of The Several States To Call On The Congress To Propose Such An Amendment.

1987.title: National Musicians' Day; recognize in Mississippi.
1987.description: A Concurrent Resolution Expressing The Desire Of The Legislature To Establish National Musicians' Day In Mississippi With The Goal Of Establishing The Celebration Nationwide And Extending The Appreciation Of The Legislature To All Mississippi Musicians.

1988.title: Mr. Jeff Cannon; commend career upon the occasion of his retirement as Pearl High Band Director.
1988.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Career And Service Of Mr. Jeff Cannon Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement As Director Of Bands At Pearl High School.

1989.title: Woody Barnett; commend upon retirement as Athletic Director of Pearl Public School District.
1989.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Woody Barnett Upon His Retirement As Athletic Director Of The Pearl Public School District And Extending The Best Wishes Of The Legislature.

1991.title: The University of MS Medical Center and Dr. Hannah Gay; congratulate for functionally curing baby infected with HIV.
1991.description: A Concurrent Resolution Congratulating The University Of Mississippi Medical Center, Dr. Hannah Gay, Dr. Katherine Luzuriaga And Dr. Debra Persaud On Functionally Curing A Baby Born With An Hiv Infection And Commending Them For A Job Well Done.

1993.title: Mr. James William (Jimmy) Warren, Jr.; commend life and legacy upon his passing.
1993.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Mr. James William (jimmy) Warren, Jr., And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1995.title: Chief Randy L. Boykin; commend life, legacy and public service of upon his passing.
1995.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life, Legacy And Public Service Of Enterprise Police Chief Randy Junior Boykin And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1996.title: Dr. Tom Burnham; commend career and service of upon the occasion of his retirement as State Superintendent of Public Education.
1996.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Dedicated And Distinguished Career Of Exceptional Service Of Dr. Tom Burnham And Congratulating Him Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement As The State Superintendent Of Public Education.

1997.title: Greenwood Public School District retirees; commend years of service.
1997.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The 2012 And 2013 Retirees Of The Greenwood Public School District For Their Many Years Of Dedicated Service.

1998.title: Claudis Ray James, Sr.; commend life and express sympathy upon his passing.
1998.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life Of Claudis Ray James, Sr., And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1999.title: U.S. Congress; urge to enact the Marketplace Fairness Act.
1999.description: A Concurrent Resolution Memorializing The United Congress To Enact The Marketplace Equity Act Or The Marketplace Fairness Act.

2000.title: Madison-Ridgeland Academy Lady Patriots Soccer team; commend for winning state championship.
2000.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Madison-ridgeland Academy Lady Patriots Varsity Soccer Team For Their Outstanding 2012-2013 Season And For Winning The School's First State Championship.

2001.title: The Holmes County Civil Rights Movement; commemorate 50th Anniversary of the beginning of and recognize Mr. and Mrs. Sojourner.
2001.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commemorating The 50th Anniversary Of The Beginning Of The Civil Rights Movement In Holmes County, Mississippi, And Recognizing The Social Contributions Of Sue Lorenzi Sojourner And Her Late Husband Henry Lorenzi Sojourner.

2002.title: John O. Gilbert; commend upon retirement after 30 years of superb public service to the state.
2002.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Mr. John O. Gilbert Upon His Retirement After 30 Years Of Exceptional Service To The State Of Mississippi.

2003.title: Singing River Electric Power Association; congratulate upon the occasion of its 75th anniversary.
2003.description: A Concurrent Resolution Congratulating Singing River Electric Power Association Upon Its 75th Anniversary.

2004.title: Corporal Jacob Wooley; honor life and legacy and express sympathy upon his passing.
2004.description: A Concurrent Resolution Honoring The Life And Legacy Of United States Marine Corps Corporal Jacob Wooley Who Died In The Line Of Duty And Expressing Deepest Sympathy Upon His Passing.

2005.title: Dr. David Cole; commend and congratulate upon occasion of his retirement as the President of Itawamba Community College.
2005.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Dedicated And Distinguished Career And Exceptional Service Of Dr. David C. Cole And Congratulating Him Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement As The President Of Itawamba Community College.

2006.title: Mr. Jimmy Bishop; commend life and service as fire chief and public servant and express sympathy upon his passing.
2006.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Service Of Mr. Jimmy Bishop And Expressing Our Deepest Sympathy Upon His Passing.

2007.title: City of Cleveland; commend on being named one of the 20 Best Small Towns to visit in 2013.
2007.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The City Of Cleveland, Mississippi, On Being Named As One Of The 20 Best Small Towns To Visit In 2013 By Smithsonian Magazine.

2008.title: Representative Jessica Upshaw; commend life, legacy and public service upon her passing.
2008.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life, Legacy And Public Service Of The Honorable Representative Jessica Sibley Upshaw, And Extending Deepest Sympathy To Her Family And Friends Upon Her Passing.

2009.title: Ingall's Shipbuilders; commend and congratulate on the occasion of its 75th anniversary.
2009.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Ingalls Shipbuilding In Pascagoula, Mississippi, On The Occasion Of Its 75th Year Anniversary Of Operation.

2010.title: Baldwyn High School Bearcats Boys Basketball Team; commend upon winning Class 2A State Championship.
2010.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Baldwyn High School Bearcats Boys Basketball Team For Winning The Class 2a State Championship.

2011.title: Chevron Pascagoula Refinery; commend and congratulate upon the occasion of its 50th year anniversary.
2011.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Chevron Pascagoula Refinery On The Occasion Of Its 50th Year Anniversary Of Operation.

2013.title: Ole Miss Men's Basketball Team; commend and congratulate upon winning SEC Tourney Championship and NCAA Tourney win.
2013.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Ole Miss Rebels Basketball Team And Head Coach Andy Kennedy For Their Impressive Victory In The Southeastern Conference Tournament Championship, Their First Ncaa Tournament Berth Since 2002, And Their First Ncaa Tournament Win Since 2001.

2015.title: Representative George Flaggs, Jr.; commend legislative legacy and service upon his retirement from the Legislature.
2015.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Representative George Flaggs, Jr., For His Legislative Legacy And Congratulating Him Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement From The Mississippi House Of Representatives.

2017.title: Mandatory student physical education requirements; provide teacher and administrator licensure suspension if not followed.
2017.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-134, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Teacher And School Administrator Licensure Suspension In Any School Wherein Mandatory Student Physical Activity Requirements Are Not Being Followed; And For Related Purposes.

2018.title: Divorce; create bona fide separation as the 13th ground.
2018.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-5-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create As A Thirteenth Ground For Divorce The Bona Fide, Complete Separation Of The Parties For A Certain Period Of Time; To Enact Certain Restrictions; And For Related Purposes.

2019.title: Appropriation FY2014; SDH operate two STD/HIV clinics in underserved areas of the state.
2019.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The State Department Of Health For The Purpose Of Establishing And Operating Two Std/hiv Specialty Clinics In Underserved Areas Of The State, For The Fiscal Year Ending June 30, 2014.

2020.title: Tax assessors and collectors; increase salaries.
2020.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Salaries Of Tax Assessors And Collectors; And For Related Purposes.

2021.title: School district expenditures; require school boards to adopt an annual balanced budget.
2021.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-61-9 And 37-61-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require School Districts To Adopt An Annual Balanced Budget To Be Submitted To The Levying Authority And To The State Board Of Education And To Clarify That School District Budgets Shall Limit Fund Expenditures To The Revenue Resources Available To That Fund Which Shall Not Include Transfers From Other Fund Balances; To Amend Section 37-61-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That No School District Fund Shall Have A Negative Balance At The End Of The School Fiscal Year; And For Related Purposes.

2022.title: Sales tax; provide for a diversion to a county of collections in fire protection districts with 5 or more casinos.
2022.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That 18-1/2% Of The Total Sales Tax Revenue Collected Each Month On Business Activities Within A Fire Protection District Created Pursuant To Section 19-5-151 Et Seq. In Which Five Or More Gaming Licensees Are Located Shall Be Allocated For Distribution To The County In Which The Fire District Is Located And Paid To The County; To Provide That The Money Allocated For Distribution And Credited To Such A County Shall Be Utilized By The County For Tourism Projects And Economic Development Projects That Are Approved By The Mississippi Development Authority; And For Related Purposes.

2023.title: Law enforcement training expenses; revise time for reimbursement of formerly employing entity.
2023.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-6-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Time During Which A Governmental Entity Must Reimburse The Formerly Employing Governmental Entity For The Costs Incurred By That Entity For The Officer's Law Enforcement Training; And For Related Purposes.

2024.title: Official state song; adopt "My Home Mississippi."
2024.description: An Act Adopting "my Home Mississippi" By Delma Furniss As The Official State Song; And For Related Purposes.

2025.title: Official Mississippi state song; authorize two state songs.
2025.description: An Act Authorizing Mississippi To Have Two Official State Songs Consisting Of The Present Official State Song "go Mississippi" And "my Home Mississippi"; And For Related Purposes.

2026.title: Paternity proceeding; court may determine custody.
2026.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-9-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, As Amended By House Bill No. 720, 2013 Regular Session, To Clarify The Jurisdiction Of The Court Over The Award Of Custody In The Course Of A Paternity Proceeding And To Authorize Reimbursement To Medicaid For Expenses Of Pregnancy And Confinement; And For Related Purposes.

2027.title: Wayne County; include in 18th Circuit Court District.
2027.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-7-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Composition Of The Eighteenth Circuit Court District To Include Wayne County; To Amend Section 9-7-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove Wayne County From The Tenth Circuit Court District; To Bring Forward Section 9-7-32, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2028.title: Mississippi Protection from Human Trafficking Act; enact.
2028.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-54.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Reporting Of Trafficking Of A Minor Under The Age Of 18 To The Mississippi Department Of Human Services As Suspected Child Abuse Or Neglect; To Amend Section 97-3-54.4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definitions Under The Protection From Human Trafficking Act; To Create Section 97-3-54.5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Forfeiture Of Any Vehicle Or Other Property Used In Furtherance Of Human Trafficking And Establish A Procedure For Forfeiture; To Create Section 97-3-54.6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Restitution To Victims Of Human Trafficking; To Create Section 97-3-54.7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Involvement Of An Undercover Agent In Detection Of An Offense Is Not A Defense To Prosecution; To Create Section 97-3-54.8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The Relief For Victims Of Human Trafficking Fund; To Amend Section 97-5-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Prosecution Thereunder Shall Not Bar Investigation And Prosecution For Human Trafficking; To Amend Section 97-29-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Immunity, Victim Status And Protective Custody For Certain Minors Who Would Be Subject To Being Charged With Prostitution Had They Been Over The Age Of 18 And To Provide Immunity From Prosecution For Adult Victims Of Human Trafficking; To Amend Section 97-29-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Amend Section 97-29-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Punishment For Procuring Prostitution Of Certain Minors; To Amend Section 97-3-54, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Anti-trafficking Act Title And Statutory References; To Amend Section 97-43-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Human Trafficking In The Definition Of Racketeering; To Amend Sections 97-5-7 And 97-5-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Prosecution Thereunder Shall Not Bar Investigation And Prosecution For Human Trafficking; To Amend Section 97-5-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Definitions Applicable To Certain Crimes Against Children; To Amend Section 97-5-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Prosecution Thereunder Shall Not Bar Investigation And Prosecution For Human Trafficking; And For Related Purposes.

2029.title: Civil actions against health care providers; provide for inadmissibility of certain statements of fault or apology.
2029.description: An Act To Provide That Certain Statements By Health Care Providers Or Employees Regarding The Unanticipated Outcome Of Medical Care Are Inadmissible In Any Civil Action By A Relative Or Representative Of The Patient; To Provide Definitions; And For Related Purposes.

2030.title: Attempted murder; clarify punishment for.
2030.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-1-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise And Clarify The Punishment For An Attempted Crime, And To Provide A Specific Penalty For The Offense Of Attempted Murder; And For Related Purposes.

2031.title: Grand jurors; revise potential number of.
2031.description: An Act To Amend Section 13-5-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Potential Number Of Grand Jurors; And For Related Purposes.

2032.title: Statutory rape; must be knowing and willful.
2032.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Knowledge And Willfulness In Order To Convict For Statutory Rape; And For Related Purposes.

2033.title: Death penalty; eliminate for persons who are mentally retarded.
2033.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Eliminate The Death Penalty For Individuals Who Are Mentally Retarded; And For Related Purposes.

2034.title: Suffrage; authorize restoration by circuit court.
2034.description: An Act To Authorize A Circuit Judge To Restore To A Defendant The Right Of Suffrage; And For Related Purposes.

2035.title: Home health services; authorize advanced practice nurses and physician assistants to provide to Medicare/Medicaid beneficiaries.
2035.description: An Act To Amend Sections 73-15-5, 73-15-20 And 73-26-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Clinical Nurse Specialists, Nurse Practitioners And Physician Assistants May Provide Home Health Services For Medicare Or Medicaid Beneficiaries Consistent With Federal Law; To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2036.title: "Mississippi Free Health Clinic Volunteers in Medicine Act"; enact.
2036.description: An Act Entitled The "mississippi Free Health Clinic Volunteers In Medicine Act"; To Provide Definitions Of Health Care Providers And Free Clinics Subject To The Provisions Of This Act; To Provide For Contracts Between Health Care Providers And Free Clinics; To Provide For The Annual Registration Of Free Clinics With The Mississippi State Department Of Health; To Provide That Health Care Providers And Volunteers Providing Services To Free Clinics Under Such Contract Shall Be Deemed Governmental Employees With Liability Immunity Protection Under The Mississippi Tort Claims Act; To Require Notification Of Such Limitation Of Liability To Patients And Recipients Of Services At Free Clinics; To Provide That Free Clinics And Health Care Providers Shall Be Assessed For The Cost Of Such Immunity Under The Tort Claims Act; To Require Certain Reports; To Amend Sections 11-46-1 And 73-25-38, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Sections 73-15-5 And 73-25-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Nurses And Nurse Practitioners To Dispense Medication To Patients In A Free Clinic Setting; To Amend Section 73-21-129, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Drug Manufacturers To Donate Drugs To Free Clinics Up To One Year Following The Labeled Expiration Date; And For Related Purposes.

2037.title: Nursing; delete requirement that advanced practice nurses must practice within collaborative relationship with a physician.
2037.description: An Act To Amend Sections 73-15-5 And 73-15-20, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Requirement That Advanced Practice Registered Nurses Must Practice Within A Collaborative Or Consultative Relationship With A Physician Or Dentist; And For Related Purposes.

2038.title: Mississippi Department of Human Services; abolish and transfer programs to federal government.
2038.description: An Act To Abolish The Mississippi Department Of Human Services Effective July 1, 2015, And To Transfer All Programs, Employees And Unexpended Balances Of Appropriated Funds Of Said Agency To The United States Department Of Health And Human Services; To Provide For The Transfer Of The Office Of Youth Services To The Office Of The Governor; To Direct The Executive Director Of The Department Of Human Services With The Assistance Of The Attorney General To Phase Out All Programs Of Said Agency And Assist In The Transfer Of Former Employees To The Federal Government; To Provide A Phase-out Plan For The Programs Administered By The Department Of Human Services; To Repeal Sections 43-1-1 Through 43-1-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establish And Provide For The Organization Of The Mississippi Department Of Human Services And The Position Executive Director Of The Department Of Human Services, Sections 43-1-31 Through 43-1-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For Mandatory State Supplemental Payments To Aged, Blind And Disabled Persons, Sections 43-1-51 Through 43-1-67, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establish And Provide Programs For The Office Of Children And Youth Of The Department Of Human Services, Sections 43-9-1 Through 43-9-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide A Program Of Old-age Assistance Under The Former Department Of Public Welfare, And Sections 43-17-1 Through 43-17-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide A Program Of Temporary Assistance To Needy Families (tanf) Under The Department Of Human Services; To Amend Section 43-27-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That, Effective July 1, 2015, The Office Of Youth Services Of The Department Of Human Services Shall Be Within The Office Of The Governor; And For Related Purposes.

2039.title: Adult care facilities; define adult day care facilities for licensure purposes.
2039.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-11-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term "adult Day Care Facility" For Purposes Of Institutional Licensure By The State Department Of Health; To Amend Section 43-11-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The State Board Of Health To Promulgate Rules, Regulations And Standards Regarding The Operation Of Adult Day Care Facilities Which Incorporate The Most Current Ranges And Levels Of Care Developed By The National Adult Day Services Association (nadsa); To Codify Section 43-11-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Fees For Adult Day Care Facility Licensure; And For Related Purposes.

2040.title: Medicaid; expand eligibility to include individuals entitled to benefits under federal Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.
2040.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Medicaid Eligibility To Include Those Individuals Who Are Entitled To Benefits Under The Federal Patient Protection And Affordable Care Act Of 2010 (aca) Beginning January 1, 2014; To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Essential Health Benefits For Individuals Eligible For Medicaid Under The Federal Patient Protection And Affordable Care Act Of 2010 (aca); And For Related Purposes.

2041.title: Community hospital services in certain counties; authorize direct negotiation with hospital in adjoining county to provide.
2041.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-13-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Certain Counties With Authorized Casino Gaming To Negotiate Directly With A New Hospital In An Adjoining County To Provide Medical Services In Publicly Operated Clinics; And For Related Purposes.

2042.title: Mississippi Acupuncture Practice Act; extend repealer.
2042.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 73-71-1 Through 73-71-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are The Mississippi Acupuncture Practice Act; To Amend Section 73-71-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Criminal Record Background Checks For Applicants; To Amend Section 73-71-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Automatic Repealer On The Mississippi Acupuncture Practice Act; To Bring Forward Section 73-23-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972; And For Related Purposes.

2044.title: Public assistance benefits; require applicants to submit to random drug testing to qualify.
2044.description: An Act To Require Adult Applicants For Public Benefits In Mississippi To Submit To Random Drug Testing In Order To Be Eligible; To Provide That Any Such Person Whose Test Results Are Positive Regarding The Presence Of Any Unlawful Drug In The Person's System Shall Be Ineligible To Receive Public Assistance For A Period Of Time Based On The Number Of Positive Drug Tests; To Provide Procedures And Exceptions For Such Random Drug Testing; To Provide Criminal Penalties For Willful Violations Of Random Drug-testing Requirements; To Make It Unlawful For Any State Agency To Provide Any Public Benefit In Violation Of Random Drug-testing Requirements; To Amend Sections 43-13-115, 43-17-1, 71-5-511 And 43-33-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specifically Require The Division Of Medicaid, The Department Of Human Services, The Office Of Employment Security And The Mississippi Housing Authorities To Require Applicants Of Public Assistance Programs To Submit To Random Drug Testing As Required Under This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2045.title: Health care certificate of need; remove moratorium on home health agencies.
2045.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Restriction Which Prohibits The State Department Of Health From Issuing A Certificate Of Need For The Establishment Or Expansion Of Approved Territory For A Home Health Agency; And For Related Purposes.

2047.title: Board of Medical Licensure; maintain publicly available education and training records on licensees.
2047.description: An Act To Create New Section 73-25-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Medical Licensure Board To Make Available To The Public The Education And Training Background Of Doctors; To Amend Section 73-52-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Provide An Extended Length Of Time For The Board To Comply With The Disclosure Requirements; And For Related Purposes.

2048.title: Licensing of graduates of foreign medical schools; authorize State Board of Medical Licensure to waive 5-year limitation.
2048.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-25-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Board Of Medical Licensure To Waive The 5-year Limitation On Licensing Of Graduates Of Foreign Medical Schools And To Establish Uniform License Fees For Such Licenses; And For Related Purposes.

2049.title: CON review requirements; exempt relocation of health care facility or major medical equipment within one mile of main entrance.
2049.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt The Relocation Of A Health Care Facility Or Major Medical Equipment Within A One-mile Radius Of The Main Entrance Of The Facility From Certificate Of Need Review Requirements; To Bring Forward Section 41-7-205, Mississippi Code Of 1972; And For Related Purposes.

2050.title: In-home care choices for Medicaid recipients; direct Division of Medicaid to apply for necessary waivers to provide.
2050.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The Division Of Medicaid To Apply For Necessary Waivers To Make Available Consumer-directed Options (choices) For Recipients Receiving Home- And Community-based Long-term Care Services Under Certain Guidelines; And For Related Purposes.

2051.title: Wildlife; exempt residents who are active or retired members of Armed Forces or sworn law enforcement officers from hunter education.
2051.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-20, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Residents Who Are Active Or Retired Members Of The Armed Forces Or Active Or Retired Sworn Law Enforcement Officers From The Requirement Of Completing A Hunter Education Course To Obtain A Hunting License; And For Related Purposes.

2052.title: Hunting; require tree stands to be tagged with name and address of owner.
2052.description: An Act To Require A Person To Tag Any Tree Stand Placed On Public Lands Or Lands Of Another Person; And For Related Purposes.

2053.title: Boating safety; require persons aboard certain vessels underway to wear a personal flotation device.
2053.description: An Act To Amend Section 59-21-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Persons Aboard Certain Vessels Underway To Wear A Personal Flotation Device; And For Related Purposes.

2054.title: Memorial highways; designate portion of Highway 82 bridge in Washington County as the "Jesse Brent Memorial Bridge."
2054.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Bridge On Highway 82 In Washington County As The "jesse Brent Memorial Bridge"; And For Related Purposes.

2055.title: Memorial highway; designate a portion of MS 25 and MS 15 in Louisville as "Blue Star Memorial Highway."
2055.description: An Act To Designate A Portion Of Mississippi Highway 25 And Mississippi Highway 15 Within The Corporate Limits Of The City Of Louisville, Mississippi, As "blue Star Memorial Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

2056.title: Memorial highways; designate Mississippi Highway 6 in Lee County as the "Military Order of the Purple Heart Highway."
2056.description: An Act To Designate Mississippi Highway 6 Within Lee County, Mississippi, As The "military Order Of The Purple Heart Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

2057.title: Radar; authorize use by sheriffs.
2057.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Sheriff Of Any County To Use Radar Speed Detection Equipment Upon Public Streets, Roads And Highways That Are Under The Jurisdiction Of The Board Of Supervisors For Maintenance And Construction And That Are Located Outside The Limits Of Any Incorporated Municipality; And For Related Purposes.

2058.title: Scenic byway; create the "Noxubee Hills Route."
2058.description: An Act To Designate Certain Highways And Roads In Choctaw, Winston And Noxubee Counties In Mississippi As An Official Mississippi Scenic Byway To Be Known As The "noxubee Hills Route"; And For Related Purposes.

2059.title: Headlights; require use during precipitation.
2059.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-7-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Headlights Of Vehicles Shall Be Operated Whenever Precipitation Necessitates The Use Of Windshield Wipers; To Prohibit The Use Of Only The Parking Lights Of Vehicles During Times When The Use Of Headlights Is Required; And For Related Purposes.

2060.title: Jury service; revise exemption based on age.
2060.description: An Act To Amend Section 13-5-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Age At Which The Exemption From Jury Service May Be Claimed As A Personal Privilege; And For Related Purposes.

2061.title: Capital murder; killing of multiple victims in a single incident.
2061.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Multiple Murders In A Single Incident Or A Murder Committed In Conjunction With An Attempted Murder Shall Constitute Capital Murder; To Amend Section 99-19-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2062.title: Justice court clerks; clarify annual educational requirement.
2062.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-11-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Annual Training Requirement Imposed Upon Justice Court Clerks; And For Related Purposes.

2063.title: Municipal and county law enforcement officer; allow spouse of officer killed in the line of duty to purchase officer's sidearm.
2063.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-9-131, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Spouse Of A Municipal Or County Law Enforcement Officer Killed In The Line Of Duty To Purchase One Sidearm Issued To Such Law Enforcement Officer; And For Related Purposes.

2064.title: Bow hunting; allow the use of crossbow and bow and arrow during any open season on deer.
2064.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-38, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Persons Exempt From Licensing And Persons Licensed To Hunt Deer With A Bow Or Primitive Weapon May Hunt With A Bow During Any Open Season On Deer; And For Related Purposes.

2065.title: Appropriation; University of Mississippi School of Education grant funds for AP teachers on the Mississippi Gulf Coast.
2065.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Grant Funds Available To The University Of Mississippi School Of Education To Defray The Expenses Of Enrolling And Educating Teachers For Advanced Placement Courses And Principals In School Districts Located In The Counties Bordering The Mississippi Gulf Coast, For Fiscal Year 2014; And For Related Purposes.

2066.title: Appropriation and budget process for federal funds; set forth conditions for matching funds.
2066.description: An Act Relating To The Appropriation Of Anticipated Federal Funds By The Legislature In Appropriations Acts, To Require State Agencies Receiving Federal Funds To Provide In Budget Submissions For The Proposed Budget Details Of Conditions Imposed On The State Applicable To Federal Funds Included In The Agency's Budget Submission, To Require The Recommended Budget Specifically To Accept In Detail Those Conditions When Federal Funds Are Included In The Proposed Budget And To Require The Agency's Submission Of An Expenditure Proposal For The Anticipated Funds To The Joint Legislative Budget Committee And The Governor To Include The Conditions Imposed On The State's Receipt And Expenditure Of The Federal Funds; To Amend Sections 27-103-103 And 27-104-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2067.title: Tuition-free attendance at any state IHL or community college; authorize for Mississippi residents age 65 or over.
2067.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-106-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Mississippi Resident Age 65 Or Over Shall Be Eligible For A Scholarship Equal To The Full Cost Of Tuition At Any State Institution Of Higher Learning Or Public Community College; To Provide That Such Waiver Shall Be Administered Under The Mississippi Resident Tuition Assistance Grant Program (mtag); And For Related Purposes.

2068.title: Appropriation FY2013; MS Gulf Coast Community College Motion Picture Industry Workforce Training.
2068.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Gulf Coast Community College For The Purpose Of Providing Motion Picture Industry Workforce Training In Coordination With The Mississippi Film Office For Fiscal Year 2014; And For Related Purposes.

2069.title: Appropriations FY2014; State Department of Health, Taborian Urgent Care Center medical services.
2069.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of State General Funds To The State Department Of Health, For The Purpose Of Implementing A Healthcare Network And Related Medical Emergency Services For The Taborian Urgent Care Center In Mount Bayou, Mississippi For Fiscal Year 2014; And For Related Purposes.

2070.title: MDA; authorize to hire consultants to periodically assess economic development incentives offered by the state.
2070.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-1-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Mississippi Development Authority To Employ Consultants To Assess The Economic Development Incentives Offered By The State; And For Related Purposes.

2071.title: SREB contract program at out-of-state college of optometry; students not required to practice in Mississippi.
2071.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-135-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Mississippi Students Participating In The Southern Regional Education Board (sreb) Contract Program At Any College Of Optometry Outside Of The State Shall Not Be Required To Return To The State Of Mississippi To Practice After Graduation; And For Related Purposes.

2072.title: Education Achievement Council; make recommendations regarding college readiness, common core and performance budgeting.
2072.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-163-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The Education Achievement Council To Develop And Make Specific Recommendations To The 2014 Regular Session Of The Legislature Regarding College Readiness, Implementation Of Common Core Standards And Implementation Of Performance-based Budgeting For Universities And Community Colleges; And For Related Purposes.

2073.title: Tuition-free attendance at any state IHL or community college; authorize for students with at least 3.0 GPA.
2073.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-106-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Mississippi Students Who Have At Least A 3.0 Grade Point Average In High School And Maintain That Average Shall Be Eligible For A Scholarship Equal To The Full Cost Of Tuition At Any State Institution Of Higher Learning Or Public Community College; And For Related Purposes.

2074.title: Funding formula for public universities and community colleges; provide phased-in performance-based formula.
2074.description: An Act To Clarify Funding Formula Calculations For State-supported Universities And Community Colleges In The State Of Mississippi In Order To Provide For Accountability And Efficiency; To Provide Restrictions On State Funding Of Academic Remedial Courses Of Instruction For Undergraduate Students Attending State-supported Universities And Community Colleges; To Provide For The Withholding And Transfer Of Adequate Education Programs To Universities And Community Colleges Providing Such Remedial Education Courses; To Provide A Performance-based Funding Formula For State-supported Universities And Community Colleges To Be Implemented On A Phased-in Basis And To Prescribe The Components Of That Formula; To Amend Sections 37-101-15 And 37-4-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Require The Department Of Finance And Administration To Acquire And Dispose Of Any Real Property On Behalf Of Any State Institution Of Higher Learning; To Amend Section 37-113-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Department To Sell Certain Real Property On Behalf Of Mississippi State University; To Amend Section 37-115-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Authority Of The University Of Mississippi To Acquire And Dispose Of Real Property On Behalf Of Said University And Its Subdivisions; And For Related Purposes.

2075.title: Student transfers between IHL and community colleges without loss of credit; provide for articulation agreements and policies.
2075.description: An Act To Authorize And Direct The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning And The Mississippi Community College Board To Develop And Implement Articulation Agreements And Policies Allowing Students To Transfer Between Programs And Institutions Without Loss Of Credit; And For Related Purposes.

2077.title: Time to degree completion of degree, reverse credit transfer for associate degree and dropped courses; IHL set policies.
2077.description: An Act Relating To Measures To Facilitate The Timely Completion Of Degrees By Students Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning; To Direct The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Implement Policies Requiring The Filing Of A Time To Completion Degree Plan With Certain Maximum Number Of Degree Hours; To Direct The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning And The Mississippi Community College Board To Implement Policies Regarding The Reverse Credit Transfer Of Academic Credit For Awarding An Associate Degree; To Prohibit A Mississippi Institution Of Higher Learning From Allowing An Undergraduate Student To Drop More Than Six Courses Without Incurring An Academic Penalty While Remaining Enrolled; To Authorize And Direct The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Adopt Rules Under Which A University May Permit A Student To Drop More Than Six Courses If The Student Shows Good Cause; To Provide For Refunding Tuition And Fees To A Student Who Withdraws From The University; To Amend Section 37-101-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2078.title: Justice court judges; increase the maximum fee for performing marriage.
2078.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-7-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Maximum Fee Which May Be Received By A Justice Court Judge For Each Marriage Ceremony He Performs In The Courtroom Or Offices Of The Justice Court; And For Related Purposes.

2079.title: Elections; increase fee paid by legislative candidates upon entering the race for party nominations.
2079.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-297, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Fee Paid By Candidates For State Senator Or State Representative Upon Entering The Race For Party Nomination For Such Offices; To Amend Section 23-15-299, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2080.title: Public employees; DFA shall publish on its website database listing all employees whose salary exceeds a certain amount.
2080.description: An Act To Create Section 27-104-163, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Department Of Finance And Administration To Publish On Its Searchable Website A Comprehensive Database Listing All Agency Personnel Whose Annual Salary Exceeds A Certain Amount; And For Related Purposes.

2081.title: Law Enforcement Officers Death/Disability Benefits Trust Funds; expand coverage to include emergency management personnel.
2081.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-2-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Coverage Of The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Death Benefits Trust Fund To Include Emergency Management Agency Personnel; To Amend Section 45-2-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Coverage Of The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Disability Benefits Trust Fund To Include Emergency Management Agency Personnel; And For Related Purposes.

2082.title: Public Records Act; cost for records shall be at pay scale of lowest level employee.
2082.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-61-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Staff Time Or Contractual Services Included In Actual Cost Of Providing Records Shall Be At The Pay Scale Of The Lowest Level Employee Or Contractor Competent To Respond To The Request; And For Related Purposes.

2083.title: State agency vehicles; extend moratorium on acquisition of.
2083.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-1-78, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Moratorium On The Acquisition Of Motor Vehicles By State Agencies; To Allow Any Agency With A Fleet Of Not More Than 50 Vehicles To Replace Certain Vehicles After Submitting Documentation To The Bureau Of Fleet Management; And For Related Purposes.

2084.title: MS Industries for the Blind; remove provision requiring salary of director to be subject to the State Personnel Board.
2084.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-3-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Provision Providing That The Compensation Of The Executive Director Of The Mississippi Industries For The Blind Is Subject To The Approval Of The State Personnel Board; And For Related Purposes.

2085.title: PERS; all records are public except elements of individual records which could be used to identify a member.
2085.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-11-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Books, Accounts And Records Of The Public Employees' Retirement System Shall Be Public Records Except For Elements Of Individual Member Record Which Could Reasonably Be Used To Identify The Member; And For Related Purposes.

2086.title: Notice of state agency meetings; shall be published on the DFA Transparency website.
2086.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-41-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Notice Of Any Regular Meeting Held By A State Agency, Other Than A Legislative Committee, Shall Be Submitted To The Department Of Finance And Administration At Least 24 Hours Before The Meeting In Order To Be Posted On The Department's Searchable Website Created By The Mississippi Accountability And Transparency Act; To Create New Section 27-104-163, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Department Of Finance And Administration To Publish Such Notices On Its Searchable Website; And For Related Purposes.

2087.title: Department of Information Technology Services; may charge vendors a fee to recover cost of providing procurement services.
2087.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-53-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Department Of Information Technology Services To Charge Fees To Vendors To Recover The Cost Of Providing Procurement Services And The Delivery Of Procurement Awards To Public Bodies; And For Related Purposes.

2088.title: Public officials; unethical to advertise official's name at public expense.
2088.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-4-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Political Officeholders From Using Public Funds To Print Their Names On Public Property Such As Cars, Pens, Warning Signs And Buildings; And For Related Purposes.

2089.title: Certified purchasing offices; revise decision procedure for the best value calculation.
