2826.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Acquire Or Dispose Of Real Property On Behalf Of Any State University Not Authorized By Law To Acquire Or Dispose Of The University's Real Property; And For Related Purposes.

2827.title: University of Southern Mississippi property; authorize DFA to sell and convey.
2827.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration, Acting On Behalf Of The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning, To Sell And Convey Certain State-owned Real Property And Any Improvements Thereon Under The Possession And Control Of The University Of Southern Mississippi, Located In Jackson County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2828.title: Pharmacy benefit manager licensure statutes; delete repealers.
2828.description: An Act To Amend Sections 73-21-83, 73-21-91, 73-21-153, 73-21-157 And 73-21-159, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Repealers On Statutes Relating To The Licensure Of Pharmacy Benefit Managers, To Increase The Licensure Fee For Pharmacy Benefit Managers And To Conform Certain Definitions; And For Related Purposes.

2829.title: Commercial or other real property owners; exempt from liability under certain circumstances.
2829.description: An Act To Exempt Commercial Or Other Real Property Owners From Liability Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2830.title: Appropriation; DFA for funds to the Mississippi Veterans Monument Commission for Shiloh National Battlefield Monument.
2830.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Department Of Finance And Administration For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To The Mississippi Veterans Monument Commission For The Construction Of A Mississippi Memorial Monument At Shiloh National Battlefield For Fiscal Year 2014; And For Related Purposes.

2832.title: Homestead exemption; certain leases between physically or mentally disabled and institutions are not homesteads.
2832.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-33-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude From The Definition Of "home" Or "homestead" Under The Homestead Exemption Law Certain Leases Between A Person Who Is Physically Or Mentally Unable To Care For Himself And The Institution In Which The Person Is Confined; And For Related Purposes.

2834.title: Corporation franchise tax; phase out for business enterprises classified and manufacturers by the IRS.
2834.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-13-5 And 27-13-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Phase Out The Corporation Franchise Tax On Business Enterprises That Are Classified Under The Internal Revenue Service Principal Business Or Professional Activity Codes As Manufacturers And Primarily Operating As A Manufacturer In This State; And For Related Purposes.

2835.title: Bonds; authorize for the replacement of Dansby Hall at Jackson State University.
2835.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Replacement Of Dansby Hall At Jackson State University; And For Related Purposes.

2836.title: Sales tax; reduce rate on sale of power and fuel to a producer of oil and gas for use in oil recovery or sequestration of carbon dioxide.
2836.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Sale Of Electricity, Current, Power, Steam, Coal, Natural Gas, Liquefied Petroleum Gas Or Other Fuel To A Producer Of Oil And Gas For Use Directly In Enhanced Oil Recovery Using Carbon Dioxide Or The Permanent Sequestration Of Carbon Dioxide In A Geological Formation Shall Be Taxed At The Rate Of 1-1/2%; And For Related Purposes.

2837.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of general obligation bonds for a headquarters for the Fannie Lou Hamer Cancer Foundation.
2837.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Constructing, Furnishing And Equipping A Headquarters Building For The Fannie Lou Hamer Cancer Foundation In Ruleville, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2840.title: Income taxation; allow a deduction for amounts contributed to accounts established to pay for uninsured wind damage to homesteads.
2840.description: An Act To Authorize Owners Of Homesteads To Establish Catastrophe Savings Accounts And To Utilize Money In Such Accounts To Provide Reimbursement For Deductible Amounts And Other Uninsured Portions Of Damage To Homesteads From Windstorm Events; To Authorize An Income Tax Deduction For Amounts Contributed To Catastrophe Savings Accounts; To Exclude Interest On Such Accounts From Gross Income For Income Tax Purposes; To Provide Limits On The Amount That May Be Contributed To Catastrophe Savings Accounts; To Provide That A Distribution From A Catastrophe Savings Account Must Be Included In The Income Of The Taxpayer Unless The Distribution Is Used To Cover Qualified Catastrophe Expenses; To Provide That The Income Tax Shall Be Increased On Taxable Distributions From A Catastrophe Savings Account; To Amend Sections 27-7-15 And 27-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2841.title: Sales tax law; include certain recycling activities in the terms "to manufacture" and "manufacturing."
2841.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include In The Definition Of The Terms "to Manufacture" And "manufacturing" Under The Sales Tax Law Certain Activities By Scrap Metal Recyclers; And For Related Purposes.

2844.title: City of Louisville; authorize a tax on hotels and motels.
2844.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Louisville, Mississippi, To Impose A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Room Rentals For Hotels Or Motels In The Town; And For Related Purposes.

2846.title: The Sweetened Beverages and Syrups Tax Law; enact.
2846.description: An Act To Create The Sweetened Beverages And Syrups Tax Law; To Provide That Distributors Who Receive, Store, Manufacture, Bottle Or Distribute Certain Sweetened Beverage Products For Sale To Retailers In This State Must Obtain From The Department Of Revenue A Permit To Engage In Such Business; To Impose An Excise Tax On Every Distributor For The Privilege Of Selling Certain Sweetened Beverage Products; To Create The Children's Health Promotion Fund; To Provide That 20% Of The Revenue From The Excise Tax Imposed By This Act Shall Be Deposited To The Credit Of The Children's Health Promotion Fund And That The Remainder Of Such Revenue Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund; To Provide For The Allocation Of The Money In Such Fund; To Provide Certain Exemptions From The Tax Levied By This Act; To Provide Penalties For Violations Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2848.title: Bonds; authorize for the Tammy Wynette Legacy Park Center.
2848.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Building, Equipping And Furnishing Facilities At The Tammy Wynette Legacy Park Center In Tremont, Mississippi, And To Provide Funds For The Purchase Of Additional Land For The Center; And For Related Purposes.

2849.title: Income tax; credit for adoption expenses is allowed in the same year that the child is claimed as an exemption.
2849.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-22.32, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Income Tax Credit For The Amount Of Qualified Adoption Expenses Paid Or Incurred By A Taxpayer To Be Allowed In The Same Taxable Year For A Child For Which An Exemption Is Claimed; And For Related Purposes.

2850.title: City of Greenwood; authorize the levy of a tax on hotels and motels to repair and renovate the Russell Building.
2850.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Greenwood, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Derived From Hotel And Motel Room Rentals In The City; To Provide That The Revenue From Such Tax Shall Be Utilized To Repair And Renovate The Russell Building Located In The City For Use As A Multipurpose Building; And For Related Purposes.

2852.title: Panola County; authorize the imposition of certain assessments to fund the Drug Abuse Resistance Education (D.A.R.E.) Program.
2852.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Panola County, Mississippi, To Levy Certain Assessments, In Addition To Any Other Assessments And Court Costs, In Certain Cases For The Purpose Of Funding A Drug Abuse Resistance Education Program Or Similar Program In The County School District; And For Related Purposes.

2853.title: City of Horn Lake; authorize the imposition of a tax on hotels and motels.
2853.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Horn Lake, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon Hotel And Motel Room Rentals, Which Shall Be Used To Promote The City's Tourism And Economic Development; To Provide That The Tax Shall Be Collected By The Department Of Revenue And Paid To The City Of Horn Lake; And For Related Purposes.

2854.title: Coahoma County; increase the amount of interest on money in the hospital special fund that may be utilized for certain expenses.
2854.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 919, Local And Private Laws Of 1996, As Last Amended By Chapter 958, Local And Private Laws Of 2012, To Increase From 50% To 100% The Amount Of The Interest Earned In The Previous Fiscal Year On The Investment Of Monies In The County Special Fund Created To Deposit Funds Received By The County As A Result Of The Lease Of The Northwest Mississippi Regional Medical Center That May Be Utilized By The Board Of Supervisors Of Coahoma County, Mississippi, For Certain Purposes; To Include The Current Expenses Of The County Which Would Otherwise Be Authorized To Be Paid Out Of County General Funds As One Of The Purposes For Which Such Interest May Be Utilized; And For Related Purposes.

2855.title: Tunica County; may enter into contracts to fund capital costs to extend natural gas services.
2855.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County, Mississippi, To Enter Into Appropriate Binding Contracts To Fund The Capital Costs Necessary To Extend Natural Gas Services To The White Oak Community And The Cypress Village Community In Tunica County; And For Related Purposes.

2856.title: Coahoma County; authorize the establishment of the Coahoma County Reserve and Trust Fund for the deposit of certain hospital lease payments.
2856.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Coahoma County, Mississippi, To Establish A Reserve And Trust Fund; To Provide That Some Or All Of The Proceeds Received By The County As A Result Of The Lease Of The Real And Personal Property Related To The Northwest Mississippi Regional Medical Center May Be Deposited Into The Fund; To Provide For The Establishment Of The Board Of Trustees Of The Reserve And Trust Fund And Provide For Its Membership; To Provide For The Powers And Duties Of The Board Of Trustees; To Provide For The Investment Of The Assets Of The Trust Fund; To Provide That The Fund Shall Be Divided Into A Corpus Component And An Earnings Components; To Provide That The Corpus Component Shall Remain Inviolate Except As Otherwise Provided In This Act; To Provide That The Earnings Component Shall Be Transferred From The Trust Fund To The General Fund Of The County And Shall Be Available For Appropriation And Spending By The Board Of Supervisors; To Authorize Money From The Corpus Of The Trust To Be Expended By The County Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2858.title: Lee County; authorize annual contributions to Sanctuary Hospice House.
2858.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lee County, Mississippi, To Contribute Annually To The Sanctuary Hospice House; And For Related Purposes.

2859.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of to assist Yazoo City in the construction of the Willie Morris Parkway.
2859.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Yazoo City, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With The Cost Of Constructing The Willie Morris Parkway To Connect Mississippi Highway 3 With Grand Avenue; And For Related Purposes.

2860.title: Bonds; increase bond authorized to be issued for certain MDA programs.
2860.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $10,000,000.00 For The Ace Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $4,000,000.00 For The Mississippi Job Protection Act Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $2,000,000.00 For The Mississippi Rural Impact Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $4,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Development Authority Workforce Training Fund; To Amend Section 57-61-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $331,500,000.00 To $341,500,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act; To Amend Section 57-61-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $40,100,000.00 To $50,100,000.00 The Amount Of Bond Proceeds That The Mississippi Development Authority May Utilize Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act To Make Loans Or Grants To Counties And Municipalities Through An Equipment And Public Facilities Grant And Loan Fund To Aid In Infrastructure-related Improvements, The Purchase Of Equipment And In The Purchase, Construction Or Repair And Renovation Of Public Facilities; To Amend Section 57-75-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $61,000,000.00 To $66,000,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued Under The Mississippi Major Economic Impact Act For Projects Designed To Enhance Facilities That Are At Risk For Closure Pursuant To The Base Closure And Realignment Act Of 1991 Or Other Applicable Federal Law And For Certain Projects Related To Military Facilities That Are No Longer Operated By The United States Armed Services Or The Mississippi National Guard; And For Related Purposes.

2861.title: Job tax credit; certain areas in Tier 1 counties can be Tier 2 or 3.
2861.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-73-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Certain Census Tracts In Tier One Areas To Be Treated As Tier Two Or Tier Three Areas For Purposes Of The Job Tax Credit; And For Related Purposes.

2862.title: Headquarters sales tax and job tax credit; revise number of jobs necessary to qualify for.
2862.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Lower To 20 The Number Of Jobs That Must Be Created At The Headquarters Of A Company Transferring Or Establishing Its National Or Regional Headquarters From Within Or Without This State In Order For The Company To Be Eligible For The Sales Tax Exemption On Sales Of Component Materials Used In The Construction Of, Or Improvements To, Its Headquarters Building; To Provide An Exemption From Sales Taxation On Sales Of Component Materials Used By A Company In Making Additions Or Improvements To Its National Or Regional Headquarters Within The State Of Mississippi If The Company Creates A Minimum Of 20 New Jobs At The Headquarters As A Result Of The Expansion Or Addition; To Amend Section 57-73-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Job Tax Credit For Any Company Expanding Or Making Additions To Its National Or Regional Headquarters Within The State Of Mississippi If A Minimum Of 20 New Jobs Are Created; To Provide That The Department Of Revenue, Rather Than The Mississippi Development Authority, Shall Establish Criteria And Prescribe Procedures To Determine If A Company Qualifies As A National Or Regional Headquarters For The Purpose Of Receiving The Job Tax Credit; And For Related Purposes.

2863.title: Special fuel tax; exempt fuel used by a commercial airline on certain interstate air service.
2863.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-55-527, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Special Fuel Sold To Be Consumed As Fuel By Planes Used By A Commercial Airline New Interstate Air Service Offered By A New Carrier In The Market, For Interstate Service To A New City By An Existing Airline Or For Additional Interstate Service To A City Already Served By A Commercial Airline, Shall Not Be Subject To The Tax Levied On Special Fuel For A Period Of 12 Months After The Date The Route Is Established; And For Related Purposes.

2865.title: Lauderdale County; authorize to fund chaplaincy program of the detention facility from revenue of inmate phone service.
2865.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lauderdale County, Mississippi, To Fund The Lauderdale County Detention Facility's Good News Jail And Prison Ministry Chaplain And Chaplaincy Program From Nontax Revenue Generated By The Inmate Telephone Service; And For Related Purposes.

2866.title: Growth and Prosperity Act; certain businesses in high poverty census tracts are eligible.
2866.description: An Act To Amend Sections 57-80-5, 57-80-7 And 57-80-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Types Of Businesses Eligible For The Tax Exemptions Authorized Under The Growth And Prosperity Act; To Provide That Certain Business Enterprises Located In Census Tracts In Which 30% Or More Of Such Tract's Population Is At Or Below The Federal Poverty Level, According To The Latest Official Data Compiled By The United States Census Bureau, May Be Eligible For The Tax Exemptions Authorized Under The Growth And Prosperity Act; And For Related Purposes.

2867.title: Appropriation; IHL - General support.
2867.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For Support Of The Eight Universities For Fiscal Year 2014; And For Related Purposes.

2868.title: Appropriation; IHL - Subsidiary programs.
2868.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For Support Of The Eight Universities' Designated Institutes, Laboratories And Programs For Which They Are Responsible And The Executive Office Of The Board Of Trustees For Fiscal Year 2014; And For Related Purposes.

2869.title: Appropriation; IHL - Student Financial Aid.
2869.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For The Support And Maintenance Of Financial Aid Scholarship, Loan And Grant Programs And The Mississippi Office Of Student Financial Aid, For Fiscal Year 2014.

2870.title: Appropriation; IHL - University of Mississippi Medical Center.
2870.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The University Of Mississippi Medical Center For Fiscal Year 2014.

2871.title: Appropriation; IHL - Alcorn State - Agricultural programs.
2871.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Alcorn State University Agricultural Programs For Fiscal Year 2014.

2872.title: Appropriation; IHL - Mississippi State University - Agricultural and Forestry Experiment Station.
2872.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Mississippi Agricultural And Forestry Experiment Station For Fiscal Year 2014.

2873.title: Appropriation; IHL - Mississippi State University - Cooperative Extension Service.
2873.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Mississippi Cooperative Extension Service For Fiscal Year 2014.

2874.title: Appropriation; IHL - Mississippi State University - Forest and Wildlife Research Center.
2874.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Incurred In The Maintenance And Operation Of The Forest And Wildlife Research Center For Fiscal Year 2014.

2875.title: Appropriation; IHL - Mississippi State University - Veterinary Medicine, College of.
2875.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For The College Of Veterinary Medicine At Mississippi State University, For Fiscal Year 2014.

2876.title: Appropriation; Community and Junior Colleges Board - Administrative expenses.
2876.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Administrative Expenses Of The Mississippi Community College Board For Fiscal Year 2014.

2877.title: Appropriation; Community and Junior Colleges Board - Support for community and junior colleges.
2877.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Aid And Support Of The Public Community And Junior Colleges Of The State Of Mississippi For Fiscal Year 2014.

2878.title: Appropriation; Corrections, Department of.
2878.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Mississippi Department Of Corrections For Fiscal Year 2014.

2879.title: Appropriation; Emergency Management Agency.
2879.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Emergency Management Agency, And For The Purpose Of Establishing A Disaster Relief Reserve Fund And Defraying The Costs Related To Certain Disaster Assistance Programs, For Fiscal Year 2014.

2880.title: Appropriation; Military - Support.
2880.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi National Guard For Fiscal Year 2014.

2881.title: Appropriation; Public Safety, Department of.
2881.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Department Of Public Safety For Fiscal Year 2014.

2882.title: Appropriation; Veterans Affairs Board.
2882.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Veterans Affairs Board For Fiscal Year 2014.

2883.title: Appropriation; Judicial Performance Commission.
2883.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Commission On Judicial Performance Of The State Of Mississippi For The Fiscal Year 2014.

2884.title: Appropriation; Ethics Commission.
2884.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Ethics Commission For The Fiscal Year 2014.

2885.title: Appropriation; Banking and Consumer Finance, Department of.
2885.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds For The Support Of The State Department Of Banking And Consumer Finance For Fiscal Year 2014.

2886.title: Appropriation; Employment Security, Department of.
2886.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security For Fiscal Year 2014.

2887.title: Appropriation; Revenue, Department of.
2887.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Department Of Revenue, Including The Homestead Exemption Division, The Motor Vehicle Comptroller Functions, The Alcoholic Beverage Control Division, And The Bureau Of Telecommunications; For The Purpose Of Reimbursing The Counties, County Districts And Municipal Separate School Districts For Tax Losses Incurred By Reason Of The Exemption Of Homes From Certain Ad Valorem Taxes; And For The Purpose Of Purchasing Motor Vehicle License Tags, For Fiscal Year 2014.

2888.title: Appropriation; Tax Appeals Board.
2888.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Board Of Tax Appeals For The Fiscal Year 2014.

2889.title: Appropriation; Workers' Compensation Commission.
2889.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Workers' Compensation Commission For Fiscal Year 2014.

2890.title: Appropriation; Mental Health, Department of.
2890.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Department Of Mental Health And Certain Programs Of The Division Of Alcohol And Drug Abuse, For Fiscal Year 2014.

2891.title: Appropriation; Development Authority, Mississippi.
2891.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Development Authority For Fiscal Year 2014.

2892.title: Appropriation; Gaming Commission.
2892.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Gaming Commission, For Fiscal Year 2014.

2893.title: Appropriation; Transportation, Department of - State Aid Road Construction, Office of.
2893.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Support And Maintenance Of The Office Of State Aid Road Construction Of The Mississippi Department Of Transportation For Fiscal Year 2014.

2894.title: Appropriation; Chiropractic Examiners, Board of.
2894.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi State Board Of Chiropractic Examiners For Fiscal Year 2014.

2895.title: Appropriation; Dental Examiners, Board of.
2895.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To The Mississippi State Board Of Dental Examiners For Fiscal Year 2014.

2896.title: Appropriation; Funeral Services Board.
2896.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds In The State Treasury To Defray The Expenses Of The State Board Of Funeral Services For Fiscal Year 2014.

2897.title: Appropriation; Massage Therapy, Board of.
2897.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Massage Therapy, For Fiscal Year 2014.

2898.title: Appropriation; Pharmacy, Board of.
2898.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Pharmacy For Fiscal Year 2014.

2899.title: Appropriation; Counselors, Board of Examiners for Licensed Professional.
2899.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Examiners For Licensed Professional Counselors For Fiscal Year 2014.

2900.title: Appropriation; Veterinary Examiners, Board of.
2900.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Veterinary Examiners For Fiscal Year 2014.

2901.title: Appropriation; Architecture, Board of.
2901.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The State Board Of Architecture And Landscape Architecture Advisory Committee For Fiscal Year 2014.

2902.title: Appropriation; Geologists, Board of Registered Professional.
2902.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Board Of Registered Professional Geologists For Fiscal Year 2014.

2903.title: Appropriation; Motor Vehicle Commission.
2903.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Motor Vehicle Commission For Fiscal Year 2014.

2904.title: Appropriation; Accountancy, Board of Public.
2904.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Public Accountancy For Fiscal Year 2014.

2905.title: Appropriation; Contractors, Board of.
2905.description: An Act Making An Appropriation From Special Funds In The State Treasury To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi State Board Of Public Contractors For Fiscal Year 2014.

2906.title: Appropriation; Agriculture and Commerce, Department of.
2906.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Department Of Agriculture And Commerce, For The Fiscal Year 2014.

2907.title: Appropriation; Egg Marketing Board.
2907.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds In The State Treasury For The Support And Maintenance Of The Mississippi Egg Marketing Board, For Fiscal Year 2014.

2908.title: Appropriation; Animal Health, Board of.
2908.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Board Of Animal Health For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Board For Fiscal Year 2014.

2909.title: Appropriation; Fair and Coliseum Commission.
2909.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Fair Commission, The Mississippi Livestock Coliseum, And The Industrial Showcase And Trade Mart Building For Fiscal Year 2014.

2910.title: Appropriation; Fair and Coliseum Commission - Livestock shows.
2910.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Fair Commission For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Dixie National Livestock Show; A Roundup For Junior Exhibitors Of Livestock And Goats; Supplemental Funds For Livestock Premiums; County Livestock Shows In Offering And Paying Prizes Or Awards To Competitors In Approved County Livestock Shows; The Five District Livestock Shows; The Five State Dairy Shows; The Mississippi High School Rodeo; And To Provide How Said Money Shall Be Paid Out Of The State Treasury For Fiscal Year 2014.

2911.title: Appropriation; Tennessee-Tombigbee Waterway Development Authority.
2911.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Tennessee-tombigbee Waterway Development Authority For The Purposes Enumerated In Section 51-27-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Fiscal Year 2014.

2912.title: Appropriation; Finance and Administration, Department of.
2912.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Department Of Finance And Administration For Fiscal Year 2014.

2913.title: Appropriation; Governor's Office and Mansion.
2913.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For Expenses Of The Executive Department, Being The Governor's Office And Staff, And For Expenses Incidental To The Proper Operation Of The Governor's Mansion And Residence Of The Governor, For Fiscal Year 2014.

2914.title: Appropriation; Audit, Department of.
2914.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The State Department Of Audit For Fiscal Year 2014.

2915.title: Appropriation; Information Technology Services, Department of.
2915.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Purpose Of Defraying The Expenses Of The Mississippi Department Of Information Technology Services For Fiscal Year 2014.

2916.title: Appropriation; Personnel Board.
2916.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The State Personnel Board For Fiscal Year 2014.

2917.title: Appropriation; Secretary of State.
2917.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Office Of The Secretary Of State For Fiscal Year 2014.

2918.title: Appropriation; Debt Service-Gen. Obli.
2918.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Payment Of Service Charges To Banks For Acting As Agents Of The State In Paying Full Faith And Credit Bonds And Interest Of The State Of Mississippi, From The Effective Date Of This Act Until Such Bonds Shall Be Paid Or Until June 30, 2014, Whichever Shall First Occur; And For The Payment Of Maturing Bonds And Interest On The Full Faith And Credit Bonds Of The State Of Mississippi Falling Due During Fiscal Year 2014.

2919.title: Appropriation; Treasurer's Office.
2919.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The State Treasurer's Office For Fiscal Year 2014.

2920.title: Appropriation; Property Insurance, Atty General Settlements, DA; Additional 2013.
2920.description: An Act Making An Additional Appropriation Of Budget Contingency Funds To Defray The Expenses Of The Department Of Finance And Administration For Fiscal Years 2013 And 2014; District Attorneys And Assistant District Attorneys For Fiscal Year 2013; The Office Of The Attorney General For Certain Legal Expenses, Judgments, And Settlements For Fiscal Year 2013; The Forestry Commission For Fiscal Year 2013; The Mississippi Emergency Management For Fiscal Years 2013 And 2014; The Department Of Public Safety Highway Patrol For Fiscal Year 2013; And For Related Purposes.

2921.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of general obligation bonds to assist in upgrading facilities at the Port of Pascagoula.
2921.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Jackson County Port Authority In Paying The Costs Of Upgrading Facilities At The Port Of Pascagoula; And For Related Purposes.

2922.title: Exempt sales of concrete and asphalt to licensed residential builders and remodelers for use in residential construction and residential improvement.
2922.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Concrete And Asphalt To Licensed Residential Builders And Remodelers For Use In Residential Construction And Residential Improvement; And For Related Purposes.

2923.title: Severance tax; reduce for 30 months for oil and gas produced from and after 7/1/13 from horizontally drilled wells.
2923.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-25-501, 27-25-503, 27-25-505, 27-25-701, 27-25-703 And 27-25-705, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Severance Tax On Oil And Natural Gas Produced From Horizontally Drilled Wells Or Horizontally Drilled Recompletion Wells From Which Production Commences From And After July 1, 2013, For A Period Of 30 Months Beginning On The Date Of First Sale Of Production; To Provide That The Revenue From Such Reduced Tax Shall Be Apportioned To The County In Which The Oil Or Natural Gas Was Produced; And For Related Purposes.

2926.title: Ad valorem taxes; municipalities may exempt improvements to residential structures in blighted areas.
2926.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-31-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of Any Municipality To Grant Exemptions From Ad Valorem Taxation, Except Ad Valorem Taxation For School District Purposes, For Improvements To Or Renovations Of Existing Residential Structures Or Existing Structures That Are Converted For Residential Use That Are Located In The Areas That Are Designated As Blighted By The Municipality, For A Period Of Not More Than 10 Years From The Date Of The Completion Of The Improvement To Or Renovation Of The Existing Residential Structure; And For Related Purposes.

2927.title: Taxation; provide for an additional tax on certain motor fuels.
2927.description: An Act To Levy A Tax On Wholesale Sales Of Gasoline, Special Fuel Or Compressed Gas Equal To 5% Of The Gross Proceeds Of Wholesale Sales Of Gasoline, Undyed Diesel Fuel Or Compressed Gas; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Revenue Collected From The Tax; To Provide For The Collection Of The Tax; To Provide Certain Exemptions From The Tax; To Amend Section 27-5-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2928.title: Adams County; authorize to contract with a private entity to provide correctional services.
2928.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Adams County, Mississippi, To Contract With A Private Entity To Provide Correctional Services To Adams County For The Confinement Of Inmates Subject To The Jurisdiction Of Adams County Including Those Awaiting Transfer To Any Other Jurisdiction Or Facility; To Provide That It Shall Be Lawful For A Correctional Facility Operated By A Private Entity That Has Contracted With The Board Of Supervisors Of Adams County To Be Located In Adams County; And For Related Purposes.

2929.title: Bonds; issued for various purposes.
2929.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Making Capital Improvements For State Institutions Of Higher Learning; To Provide That It Is The Intent Of The Legislature To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds During The 2014 And 2015 Regular Sessions For The Capital Needs Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning As Recommended By The Department Of Finance And Administration In Reports Submitted To The Senate Finance Committee And The House Ways And Means Committee; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Making Capital Improvements For Community And Junior Colleges; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Mississippi Community Heritage Preservation Grant Fund; To Amend Section 39-5-145, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With The Repair And Renovation Of And Upgrades And Improvements To The Mississippi Craft Center In Ridgeland, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Improvements To The Jackson Zoo; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying The Costs Of Repairing Damage To Lovett Elementary School In Clinton, Mississippi, That Occurred As A Result Of A Hailstorm On March 18, 2013; To Amend Section 45, Chapter 480, Laws Of 2011, To Increase The Amount Of State General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Mississippi Railroad Improvements Fund; To Amend Section 7, Chapter 520, Laws Of 2010, To Authorize The Waiver Of Certain Conditions That Must Be Satisfied Before State General Obligation Bonds May Be Issued For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The North Central Mississippi Regional Railroad Authority Grant Program And To Extend The Time Within Which Such Bonds May Be Issued; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With The Design, Fabrication And Installation Of Permanent Exhibits, Including The Development Of All Associated Films And Interactive Components, For The Grammy

2931.title: Sales taxation; exempt sales of supplies used in the treatment of diabetes and sales to certain diabetes foundations.
2931.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Certain Home Medical Equipment And Supplies When Payment For The Equipment And Supplies Is Made, In Part Or In Whole, On Behalf Of Or For The Benefit Of An Insured Under An Insurance Policy, Contract Or Plan; To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Any Instrument, Device, Appliance, Accessories Or Supplies Used For The Diagnosis, Testing Or Treatment Of Diabetes, Or Used In The Administration Of Medicines For Diabetes Or The Testing Of Blood Glucose; To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Tangible Personal Property And Service To The Diabetes Foundation Of Mississippi And The Mississippi Chapter Of The Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation; And For Related Purposes.

2932.title: Sales tax; exempt admission to and parking at certain livestock and agricultural facilities.
2932.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-65-22 And 27-65-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Any Admissions To And Parking At Livestock Facilities, Agriculture Facilities Or Other Facilities Constructed, Renovated Or Expanded With Funds From The Grant Program Authorized Under Section 18 Of Chapter 530, Laws Of 1995, If The Proceeds Do Not Inure To Any Individual Or Individuals; And For Related Purposes.

2933.title: State Infrastructure Fund; create & deposit certain bond proceeds and tax revenue in; increase certain tax rates by .1%.
2933.description: An Act To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury To Be Designated The "infrastructure Improvement Fund"; To Require A Certain Amount Of The Revenue Collected From Income, Sales And Use Taxes And Gaming Fees To Be Deposited Into The Fund; To Authorize The Proceeds Of Bonds Issued Pursuant To This Act To Be Deposited Into The Fund; To Require The Tax Revenue Deposited Into The Fund To Be Utilized To Pay The Principal And Interest On Any Bonds Issued Pursuant To This Act; To Require A Certain Amount Of The Money Deposited Into The Fund To Be Distributed In Certain Amounts To Municipalities, Counties And The State To Be Utilized Exclusively For Infrastructure Projects; To Require A Certain Amount Of The Money Deposited Into The Fund To Be Distributed To The State Highway Fund To Be Used Exclusively For Construction, Reconstruction And Maintenance Of The Highways Of This State; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The State Infrastructure Improvement Fund; To Amend Sections 27-7-5, 27-7-45, 27-65-17, 27-65-19, 27-65-22, 27-65-23, 27-65-25, 27-65-26, 27-65-75, 27-67-31, 75-76-177 And 75-76-129, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Income Sale And Use Tax Rate And The Gaming Fee Rate By One-tenth Of One Percent And To Require A Certain Amount Of The Revenue Collected From Income, Sales And Use Taxes And Gaming Fees To Be Deposited Into The "infrastructure Improvement Fund"; To Amend Section 27-104-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2934.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of general obligation bonds to purchase real estate for the University Medical Center.
2934.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Acquire Certain Real Estate In The City Of Jackson For The Use And Benefit Of The University Of Mississippi Medical Center; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Purchase Such Property; And For Related Purposes.

2935.title: Mississippi Infrastructure Company Recovery Act of 2013; create,.
2935.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Infrastructure Company Recovery Act Of 2013; To Amend Section 27-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude From Gross Income Under The State Income Tax Law, Amounts Received By A Foreign Infrastructure Affiliate Employee From An Infrastructure Company Or A Foreign Infrastructure Company Affiliate For Disaster Or Emergency Related Work Performed During A Disaster Period; To Define The Terms "disaster," "disaster Or Emergency Related Work," "disaster Period," "foreign Infrastructure Company Affiliate," "foreign Infrastructure Affiliate Employee," "infrastructure" And "infrastructure Company" For The Purposes Of Such Exclusion From Gross Income; To Amend Section 27-7-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Activity Of A Foreign Infrastructure Company Affiliate That Is Conducted In This State Relating To A Disaster Shall Be Disregarded With Respect To Any Filing Requirements For Income Tax Purposes; To Amend Sections 27-7-303, 27-7-305 And 27-7-333, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Terms "disaster," "disaster Or Emergency-related Work," "disaster Period," "foreign Infrastructure Company Affiliate," "foreign Infrastructure Affiliate Employee," "infrastructure" And "infrastructure Company" Under The State Income Tax Withholding Law; To Provide That A Foreign Infrastructure Company Affiliate Will Not Be Considered To Have Established A Presence In The State That Would Require The Business To Withhold Or Remit Any Taxes From A Foreign Infrastructure Affiliate Employee Or To Otherwise Be Subjected To Any Employer Tax Withholdings With Respect To Disaster Or Emergency-related Work Performed During A Disaster Period; To Amend Section 27-13-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Corporation Franchise Tax Exemption For A Foreign Infrastructure Company Affiliate That Conducts Operations Within The State Solely For Purposes Of Performing Disaster Or Emergency-related Work During A Disaster Period; And For Related Purposes.

2936.title: Madison County; increase the amount of bonds that may be issued for the Madison County Economic Development Authority.
2936.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 947, Local And Private Laws Of 1979, As Last Amended By Chapter 961, Local And Private Laws Of 1998, To Authorize The Madison County Economic Development Authority To Borrow $100,000,000.00 Secured By Execution Of A Deed Of Trust Or Lease Upon Any Property Owned Or Leased By The Authority, Or Other Collateral Available To Or In The Possession Of The Authority; And For Related Purposes.

2937.title: City of Pascagoula; authorize the levy of a tax on restaurants.
2937.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Pascagoula, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Derived From The Sale Of Prepared Foods By Restaurants In The City; To Provide That The City May Utilize The Revenue From The Tax To Implement A Comprehensive Parks And Recreation Master Plan Adopted By The City; And For Related Purposes.

2938.title: Marshall County; revise the boundaries of the Marshall Utility Services Sewer District.
2938.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 947, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, As Amended By Chapter 950, Local And Private Laws Of 2012, To Revise The Boundaries Of The Marshall Utility Services Sewer District; And For Related Purposes.

2939.title: Walnut Grove; members of the Board of Commissioners of the Walnut Grove Correctional Authority may receive per diem compensation.
2939.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Commissioners Of The Walnut Grove Correctional Authority To Receive Per Diem Compensation For Attending Meetings Of The Board Of Commissioners; And For Related Purposes.

2941.title: Kemper County; authorize a contribution to Mississippi Community Development Empowerment, Inc.
2941.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Kemper County, Mississippi, To Make A Contribution To The Mississippi Community Development Empowerment, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

2942.title: Sebastopol Natural Gas District; revise the boundaries of and authorize sale of bonds issued by at public or private sale.
2942.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 998, Local And Private Laws Of 1998, As Last Amended By Chapter 948, Local And Private Laws Of 2012, To Expand The Boundaries Of The Sebastopol Natural Gas District; To Authorize Bonds Issued By The Board Of Commissioners Of The Sebastopol Natural Gas District To Be Sold On Sealed Bids At Public Sale Or At Private Sale, In The Discretion Of The Board Of Commissioners; And For Related Purposes.

2943.title: Warren County; authorize contributions to various organizations.
2943.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Warren County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To Central Mississippi Prevention Services, Inc.; Mississippi Food Network; Triumph Ministries, Inc.; Vicksburg Family Development Services, Inc.; Warren Washington Issaquena Sharkey Community Action Agency, Inc.; We Care Community Services, Inc.; And Women's Restoration Shelter Of Mountain Faith Ministries; And For Related Purposes.

2944.title: City of Gautier; increase hotel/motel tax and extend repeal date.
2944.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 951, Local And Private Laws Of 2012, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Gautier, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants And Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Provides That The Revenue From The Tax Shall Be Expended By The City For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To Improve Parks And Recreation Facilities For The Purpose Of Tourism And Economic Development Within The City; To Revise The Amount Of Tax That May Be Levied From 1% To 2% On The Gross Proceeds Of Sales From Such Restaurants, Hotels And Motels; And For Related Purposes.

2945.title: Kemper County; authorize sheriff to use radar on county roads.
2945.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Kemper County, Mississippi, To Purchase Radar Speed Detection Equipment For Use By The Sheriff's Department Of The County In The Enforcement Of Speed Limits On The Roads, Streets And Highways Of The County Outside The Corporate Limits Of Any Incorporated Municipality; And For Related Purposes.

2946.title: Lafayette County Reserve and Trust Fund; make revisions regarding the governance of the trust fund.
2946.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 953, Local And Private Laws Of 2012, To Include Capital Gains Within The Definition Of "income" For Purposes Of The Lafayette County Reserve And Trust Fund; To Make It Clear That The Board Of Supervisors Of Lafayette County Is Not Required To Appoint An Advisory Committee For The Trust Fund; To Provide That The Board Of Trustees Of The Lafayette County Reserve And Trust Fund Shall Meet At Least Once Per Year; To Make It Clear That The Meetings Of The Board Of Trustees Of The Trust Fund Are Governed By The Open Meetings Law; To Make It Clear That The That The Lafayette County Reserve And Trust Fund Is A Political Subdivision For Purposes Of The Tort Claims Law; To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of The Trust Fund To Delegate Investment Authority To Investment Advisors; To Provide That Every Fiscal Year After The Fund Is Established The Earning Component Shall Be Considered An Amount Equal To 3% Of The Amount Of The Full Fund Balance Calculated At The End Of Each Fiscal Year, Whether Or Not The Corpus Component Has Generated Any Income In That Fiscal Year And To Provide That All Remaining Portions Of The Annual Income Earned From The Investment Of The Fund Shall Remain In The Fund As A Part Of The Corpus Component; To Provide That The Board Of Trustees May Expend From The Corpus Component Amounts Required To Pay The Amounts Required In Connection With The Management By The Trustees Of The Fund If The Earnings Component Is Insufficient To Pay The Amounts Required In Connection With The Management By The Trustees Of The Fund; To Revise The Amount Of The Trust Fund That May Be Transferred To The County For Special Projects; To Provide That There Shall Be No Distribution Of The Earnings Component If The Full Fund Balance Of The Trust Fund Falls Below An Amount Equal To The Initial Deposit To The Trust Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2948.title: City of Drew; authorize expansion of water distribution system to areas more than 5 miles outside city limits.
2948.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Drew In Sunflower County, Mississippi, To Expand Its Water Distribution System Within Certain Areas That Are More Than Five Miles Outside The Corporate Limits Of The City Of Drew; And For Related Purposes.

2949.title: City of Greenwood; authorize donations of certain Katrina cottages to nonprofit organizations that provide low-income housing.
2949.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Greenwood, Mississippi, To Donate Some Or All Of The Katrina Cottages Conveyed To The City In 2011 By The Mississippi Emergency Management Agency To Bona Fide Not-for-profit Organizations Engaged In Providing Low-income Housing; And For Related Purposes.

2950.title: Senate Rules; amend to delete requirement that bills or resolutions shall be on legal-sized paper.
2950.description: A Resolution To Amend Senate Rule No. 73 To Delete The Requirement That Bills And Resolutions Shall Be On Legal-sized Paper.

2951.title: Commend distinguished service of Jean Nall to the Mississippi Senate.
2951.description: A Resolution Commending Jean E. Nall For Her Distinguished Service In The Mississippi Senate.

2961.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Philanthropy And Civic Leadership Of Former State Senator John T. Keeton, Jr., Of Grenada, Mississippi, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature On His Passing.

2962.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Public Service Of Former Mississippi Senator Paul Richard "rick" Lambert Of Hattiesburg And Gulfport, Mississippi, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

2966.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Public Service Of Former Mississippi State Senator Frederick Mckinney "fred M." Belk, Jr., Of Marshall County, Mississippi, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

2968.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Public Service And Civic Leadership Of Five-term Biloxi Councilman Tom Wall And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature On His Passing.

2969.description: A Concurrent Resolution Remembering The Gallant Service And Mourning The Loss Of United States Army Reserve Master Sergeant Coater B. Debose Of State Line, Mississippi, From Injuries Sustained In Action In Afghanistan On August 19, 2012.

2971.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Starkville High School "yellowjackets" Football Team And Head Coach Jamie Mitchell For Winning The 2012 Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 5a State Championship.

2973.description: A Concurrent Resolution Remembering And Commending The Sports Legacy Of The 1964-1965 Lanier High School "bulldogs" National Championship Basketball Team.

2975.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Commemorate And Recognize The Last Speech Given In Mississippi By The Reverend Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr., During The "poor People's March" On March 16, 1968, At Jennings Temple Christian Methodist Episcopal Church In Greenwood, Mississippi.

2976.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing January 2013 As "rotary Awareness Month In Mississippi"

2977.title: Constitution; amend Section 121 to require the Governor to give at least 10 days' notice before convening an extraordinary session.
2977.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 121, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Require The Governor To Give The Legislature At Least 10 Days' Notice Before Convening An Extraordinary Session, Except In Case Of An Emergency; And For Related Purposes.

2978.title: Martin Luther King birthday; Legislature not convene.
2978.description: A Concurrent Resolution Declaring That The Legislature Shall Not Meet On The Third Monday Of January, Being The Legal Holiday Honoring The Birthday Of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.; That The New Capitol Building Shall Be Closed Except For Ceremonial Uses And That The Legislative, Gubernatorial And Other Employees Working In The New Capitol Building Shall Not Be Required To Work In Order To Observe That Legal Holiday; And For Related Purposes.

2979.title: Taxation; joint committee to study state tax system.
2979.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Create A Study Committee To Study The Tax System Of This State And To Make Recommendations Thereon To The Legislature; And For Related Purposes.

2980.title: Constitution; amend Section 208 to allow the use of public funds for student aid to students attending religious schools.
2980.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 208 Of The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 To Allow The Use Of Public Funds To Provide Grants, Scholarships, Loans Or Other Assistance To Students Attending Religious Schools.

2981.title: Constitution; amend Section 112 to allow single-family, owner-occupied real property that is not a primary residence to be Class I.
2981.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 112 Of The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 To Provide That If The Primary Residence Of A Person Is Single-family, Owner-occupied Residential Real Property Located In This State And The Person Owns Other Single-family, Owner-occupied, Residential Real Property In This State, The Primary Residence Of The Person And One Other Owner-occupied Residential Real Property Of The Person's Choosing May Be Classified As Class I; To Provide That If The Property Chosen Is For Sale, That Property May Retain Its Class I Classification Only For 12 Months After The Date It Is Put On Sale.

2982.title: Designate "National Adult Education and Family Literacy Week in Mississippi."
2982.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Designate The Second Week Of September 2013 As "national Adult Education And Family Literacy Week In Mississippi."

2983.title: Constitution; prohibit pardon of certain violent crimes and revise notice requirements for other crimes.
2983.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 124, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That The Governor Cannot Grant Pardons For Certain Violent Crimes And Requires Publication Of Notice For Less Violent Crimes; To Provide That Nonviolent Crimes Do Not Have To Meet Notice Requirements For Pardons; And For Related Purposes.

2984.title: Recognize global impact of the Mississippi file industry and declare January 17, 2013 as "Mississippi Film Day."
2984.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Enormous Global Impact Of The Mississippi Film Industry And Declaring January 17, 2013, As "mississippi Film Day."

2985.title: Unfunded state mandates; amend Constitution to prohibit.
2985.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 To Provide That No Bill Imposing An Unfunded State Mandate On Municipalities, Counties, School Districts Or Other Political Subdivisions Shall Be Enacted; To Provide That No Bill Imposing Such A State Mandate Shall Be Enacted Without Statements Of The Estimated Cost Of Such Mandate And The Source Of State Revenue Identified To Defray The Cost; And For Related Purposes.

2986.title: Amendment to the United States Constitution relating to parental rights; urge Congress to propose.
2986.description: A Concurrent Resolution Requesting The Congress Of The United States To Propose An Amendment To The Constitution Of The United States Relating To Parental Rights And Urging The Legislative Bodies Of The Several States To Call On The Congress To Propose Such An Amendment.

2987.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating September 8-14, 2013, As "paralegal Week In The State Of Mississippi."

2988.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The 43rd Anniversary Of Earth Day And Designating April 22, 2012, As "mississippi Earth Day 2013: What Are You Doing To Protect The Planet" And Urging All State Agencies And Citizens To Be Energy Stewards.

2989.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Brookhaven Academy "cougars" Football Team And Head Coach Tripp Mccarty For Winning The Mississippi Association Of Independent Schools (mais) Aa State Championship.

2990.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Brookhaven Academy "cougars" Varsity Cheerleading Squad And Head Coach Valarie Oglesby For Winning The 2012 Mississippi Association Of Independent Schools (mais) Aa State Championship.

Belue Of Clinton, Mississippi, Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement From The Board Of Trustees Of The Public Employees' Retirement System Of Mississippi (pers) And Extending The Best Wishes Of The Legislature.

2994.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The 25th Anniversary Of The National Board For Professional Teaching Standards And Commending The 3,420 National Board-certified Teachers In Mississippi, 101 Who Were Newly Certified In 2012.

2997.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Noxubee County "tigers" Football Team And Coach Tyrone Shorter For Their Perfect 2012 Season And Class 4a State Championship And For Their Clarion-ledger Super 10 No. 1 Ranking.

3033.title: Recognize Gulf States Marine Fisheries Commission Executive Director Larry Simpson on his receipt of the Charles H. Lyles Award.
